jobDescription: Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Analog or Mixed Signal IC Design Engineer | Power Products Analog Devices | Multiple Locations Analog Devices Overview Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) is a world leader in the design, manufacture, and marketing of a broad portfolio of high-performance analog, mixed-signal, and SoC integrated circuits (ICs) used in virtually all types of electronic equipment, dedicated to solve the toughest engineering challenges. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital with unmatched technologies that sense, measure, power, connect, and interpret. Position Overview Do you love drinking from the firehose of your electrical engineering program? Ready for the challenge? Look no further to launch your career in Power IC Design at Analog Devices. Recent college graduates work directly through mentorship to develop power products from day one. The new product development environment provides tremendous opportunities for learning and growth. Collaborate with a worldwide network of highly experienced designers to broaden your engineering capabilities as you develop best in class integrated circuits. Expand your leadership talents by working with engineers in multiple disciplines such as IC packaging, test, layout, and applications while releasing your designs into production. We are in an age of rapid, radical change and growth in the fields of data access and storage, 5G communications, autonomous vehicles, medical systems, and space exploration. A common thread in these fields is a need for robust and reliable power. Your work on the industry’s most advanced power solutions will help push the technology envelope with the potential to reach millions of end users around the globe. As An Analog IC Design Engineer, You Will Design new power IC products in a team setting Develop and simulate system-level and transistor-level circuits using state of the art simulation tools Develop IC layout plans and work with layout engineers; design IC packaging Evaluate and debug ICs in a lab setting with wide array of test equipment Implement circuit fixes as needed to bring circuits into production Study customer applications and feedback as basis for continuous design/product improvement What You Need To Be Successful In This Role Understanding fundamentals of analog/mixed circuit design and device physics Experience with circuit design/simulation toolsets such as Cadence Passion and dedication in taking ownership of a project from start to finish Ability to find and fix circuit and application problems in the laboratory Diligence to work independently and be self-directed; detail oriented Enthusiasm for collaboration and sharing knowledge with colleagues Requirements B.S. or M.S. in EE or similar with significant electrical circuits/simulation coursework Coursework or experience in power electronics a plus Why You Will Like Working At ADI We place great value on individual judgment We allow our employees the freedom to explore new ideas and the autonomy to determine how to best achieve business goals and objectives We emphasize professional development and mentoring Above all, we recognize that the personal goals of our employees and the company’s goals are closely related and must support each other For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Knowledge and experience with laboratory equipment; Multimeters, Spectrum Analyzers, Frequency generators, Power supplies, etc. Good written and verbal communication skills, and ability to work in a team Academic exposure to high performance converters (ADC/DAC) including current steering DACs and Pipeline ADC converters is beneficial but not a must. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Associate Designer, Layout Job Description Candidate will perform custom mask layout design of high performance radio frequency and/or high voltage analog/mixed signal integrated circuits based on provided schematics. The IC layout will include floor-planning, consideration for reducing device parasitics and noise and providing appropriate power routing. Layout from the cell level to full chip assembly will be required. Post layout verification using integrated tools will be completed, including parasitic extraction and IC Designer review. Will be an active member of an aggressive multi-discipline product development organization. IC Layout Designers will be individual contributors responsible for layout and scheduling of major blocks and/or individual cells. Required Skills 0-5 years IC layout experience, AS Degree in related area preferred Cadence Virtuoso Custom IC design tool experience including VXL Physical verification using Cadence Assura/Mentor Calibre including parasitic extraction Cadence Skill programming experience a plus Good communication skills For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Visit Associate UX Designer (Graduate) The Role The role of the Digital Customer Experience (DCX) team is to create frictionless digital journeys on analog.com for customers to Find, Choose and Use Analog Devices products and solutions. As a UX Designer on the DCX team you will work closely with business leads, UX researchers, SEO & Content Specialists as well as Developers to create simple but effective digital experience for our customers. The ideal candidate will have a track record of working on UX for customer facing products and processes, ideally within the realm of Digital Customer Experience. As a UX Designer you will be passionate about the role of the customer in the creation and iteration of digital experiences and display a strong sense of empathy for design engineers, component buyers and other key audiences. Responsibilities Gain a deep understanding of the digital product you are assigned to, it’s purpose and how it should make life easier for our customers. Translate concepts into UX deliverables for the products you support. For example: low fidelity wireframes, prototypes, high fidelity mockups, journey maps, story boards etc Work closely with UX Researchers to conduct validation on potential solutions (such as user interviews, facilitating workshops) and to incorporate feedback/insights post validation. Own and communicate a point of view on critical topics, advocating for the customer whilst balancing against business goals Proactively identify opportunities for optimization – focus on small incremental changes as well as big bang projects. Work with and contribute to the ADI digital design system. Incorporate feedback from customer interactions to ensure design system and component library are evolving with our knowledge of customer behavior. Participate in design reviews and partake in healthy debate which results in the best customer experience. Be a champion of experimentation and support structured approaches to optimization of digital experiences. Actively contribute to the UX Design team culture, processes, and documentation. Qualifications Strong understanding of UX design and research methodology, with formal training or relevant work experience A portfolio, case studies or similar documentation demonstrating past work experience, relevant projects and UX Design deliverables Expertise in UX software, in particular Axure and Figma Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences. Visit The ATE Group located in Wilmington, MA is currently seeking a motivated Analog/Digital Design Engineer for the IC development of new products. Products in this strategy are comprised of integrated high speed and precision signal chains targeted towards Automated Test Equipment (ATE) applications. Product designs utilize both advanced internal 0.18um BiCMOS SiGe processes as well as standard 0.18um CMOS processes and fine line CMOS processes. These designs are then combined on a laminate package to provide our top tier customers with a custom SIP (System In a Package) solution otherwise known as a chiplet. The candidate’s responsibilities will include transistor level schematic design and simulation of mixed signal circuits including high speed drivers and receivers, DACs, opamps and references. Assisting in the system architecture design will also be necessary to ensure designs operate functionally between blocks. Duties also include working with evaluation engineers to compare and contrast simulation and lab results. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated individual and fast learner with strong technical, analytical and communication skills. The candidate will have the opportunity to learn high speed design techniques, gain system level design experience, work with newly developed internal BiCMOS processes and collaborate closely with an experienced development team. Job responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following: Design of analog/digital circuits including high-speed drivers and receivers as well as precision circuits including PPMUs and voltage references. Simulation at the transistor circuit level with internal Spice tools Verification of top level system designs with Verilog and co-simulation tools Collaboration with the ATE design team to determine implementation of requirements at the system level Participate in customer collaboration to determine product architecture needs Work closely with evaluation engineers when silicon arrives to compare and contrast simulation results including eye diagrams, jitter and timing accuracies Preparation and presentation of design review documentation packages Qualifications Knowledge and/or experience in Digital or Analog Bipolar Circuit Design a plus Ability to collaborate in a team environment Knowledge of Spice simulators and CAD tools (Cadence Virtuoso). Knowledge of Verilog and/or System level verification tools Ability to problem solve at the transistor and system levels Knowledge of lab equipment including digital oscilloscopes, source generators and BER testers Good presentation and writing/communication skills. We value diversity We allow our employees the freedom to explore new ideas and the autonomy to determine how to best achieve business goals and objectives. We emphasize professional development and mentoring. Above all, we recognize that the personal goals of our employees and the company’s goals are closely related and must support each other. Position Overview Our rotation programs are a great way for you to understand different business/technology groups, practice relevant skills, and meet key connections for your future at ADI. Within the Graduate Rotational Development Program, you will be placed in a two-year long program that offers real-world experience, providing an excellent foundation for career growth and advancement. During the program, you will go through a structured, progressive curriculum including four rotations where you will receive professional development opportunities and mentorship before integration into the sales team. In addition, some skills you will develop include, but are not limited to: Analog / Mixed-Signal circuit and system design Assisting in the design and evaluation of customer systems – hardware and software Understanding and disseminating Customers' system needs versus wants Developing and maintaining relationships with customers and ADI’s product line management, marketing, and engineering Educating customers about ADI’s products, services, and system solutions through technical presentations and demonstrations Sales Integration Overview After completing the Graduate Rotational Development Program, you will enter Analog Devices’ sales organization as a Field Applications Engineer in the Minneapolis, Minnesota marketplace. As a Field Applications Engineer, you will work collaboratively with our sales team to engage our customers, understanding and solving their most challenging application-level problems that span a broad range of technologies in many end markets, including digital healthcare, aerospace and defense, industrial, etc. What You Need To Be Successful In This Role Experience with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, along with soldering and debugging skills Solid analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Ability to build lasting, influential relationships, internal and external Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and changing environment Ability to take initiative and drive for results Ability to influence decisions through a sense of urgency and competitive drive Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering Basic understanding of schematics, layouts and electronic components Knowledge and understanding of analog, mixed-signal, or digital circuitry (e.g., sensors, op-amps, DC/DC power, data converters, processors, etc.) Ability to travel 10% of the time Flexibility and desire to relocate to the Minneapolis, Minnesota area upon completion of the development program. jobTitle: Associate Engineer, Mixed Signal Design Engineering
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. The CTO Office's Platform IP Development group is seeking an entry-level analog/power IC designer to join our team. As part of this role, you will develop key strategic IP that will be leveraged across multiple businesses/product opportunities throughout the company. A key focus area for this position includes interacting with internal customers to communicate, improve, and maintain developed IP. Primary IP design area targets power management; however, design efforts will span a wide application range including precision references, IOs, and mixed-signal/analog circuitry. Responsibilities Include Work with teams across the company to support IP integration Design, simulate, and verify analog and mixed-signal integrated IP, taking developments from definition to completion Work closely with layout engineers to determine best strategies for minimizing parasitic/proximity effects and to optimize matching and overall performance Create test/characterization plans to fully evaluate/debug IP Document and present each design and corresponding results Support characterization/debug in the lab/ATE environments Qualifications/Requirements MSEE or PhD, concentration of analog or mixed-signal IC design Good written and verbal communication skills (clarity of message with good attention to detail) Efficient and organized work methodology for optimal multi-tasking Comfortable using Cadence design/simulation tools Understands parasitic/proximity layout effects and mitigation/optimization techniques Ability to problem solve at the circuit/systems levels Skilled with characterization/debug in a lab/ATE environment Ability to work independently and collaborate as part of team Passionate about learning different areas in design, applications, and products Desirable Experience with analog or mixed-signal product development IC Design exposure to switching power applications For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Position Overview As ADI expands into new product and market segments, the Automatic Test Equipment Group is looking for a skilled Mixed-Signal/Analog IC Design Engineer based in Colorado Springs, CO who will be responsible for designing high performance mixed-signal ICs with companion DC/DC converters targeted at industrial, and automatic test equipment markets. As a Mixed-Signal/Analog IC Design Engineer, You Will Perform a Full Range Of Product Development Activities Including, But Not Limited To Transistor-level circuit design and simulation Architect, implement and analyze trade-offs of analog blocks Design and/or integrate ADCs and DACs into an IC Perform mixed-signal IC simulation and modelling in addition to MATLAB analysis Evaluate and troubleshoot complex integrated circuit problems in the laboratory Interface with test, product and applications engineering to successfully bring new products from initial concept through production release Oversee and support analog layout Support inquiries from applications engineers Product datasheet authoring and review Requirements MSEE or equivalent with a strong background in analog and mixed-signal design Strong background in device physics and semiconductor processing Experience with mixed-signal design, simulation and modelling Motivated, results oriented and creative problem solver with good writing, presentation and overall communication skills Ability to collaborate in a team environment Knowledge of general lab equipment Must be self-directed, detail-oriented and thorough Why You Will Like Working At ADI We place great value on individual judgment. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Position Requirements Candidate must be graduating in 2022/2023 with a Bachelor of Science degree in Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Materials Science, Physics, or Electrical Engineering with a focus on the prior disciplines Candidate must be able to work in a clean room Wafer Fab environment Familiarity with Statistical Process Control, Design of Experiments, and/or Lean Manufacturing is desirable Prior experience working in a semiconductor fab or similar environment or working with semiconductor processing equipment is a plus Must be comfortable and able to be successful working both in a team setting, as well as independently Good written and verbal communication skills necessary Ability to do critical thinking and multi-tasking is essential Shows high level of initiative Experience using M/S Excel and Word. Familiarity with M/S Project is a plus. Job Description Entry level Wafer Fab process sustaining engineering position Requires individual to work as a team with other semiconductor process engineers in Wafer Fab. Initial responsibilities will be in the areas of Chemical and Physical Vapor Deposition (PECVD, LPCVD, Thin Films, SOG and associated metrology equipment). Candidate will have responsibility for providing process sustaining engineering support to the Wafer Fab. This includes root cause analysis to develop process improvements, as well as utilizing Statistical Process Control (SPC) techniques to monitor and address and improve process variation. Candidate will be required to work on continuous improvement projects, all in support of improving productivity and fabrication yields and lowering costs, in Wafer Fab. Candidate will also be working on machine learning projects to reduce reliance on monitor wafers and to use output data, from equipment, instead to control processes. Visit Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Analog Device's technology can be found at the cutting edge of new technologies that are transforming the world in automotive, communications, aerospace, industrial, healthcare and power management. This is an opportunity to contribute to innovative RF/converter-based System on a Chip (SoC) platform technology development, and to drive the key fundamental software engineering at ADI with the focus on providing complete subsystem solutions. This embedded software (firmware) engineering role resides within the Advanced Data-converter Group (ADG) in the ADEF Division. The goal of the ADG software engineering team is to develop and deploy production quality software and sub-system platform solutions to our customers and partners to enable them to build systems and end-products for multiple applications/segments – high-speed communications systems, programmable and flexible software-defined Radio systems, RADAR systems, and high speed/bandwidth test equipment, to name a few. These systems include both standards-based and proprietary implementations, and are deployed in civil (healthcare, industrial, automotive, consumer) as well as defense applications. This role requires an energetic and motivated individual with strong communication, organizational, and technical skills who works well in a diverse environment across a geographically-distributed organization. Key Responsibilities Architect, Design, Develop and Verify embedded system software and device drivers for RF/high-speed converter front end, chips, and SoC products. Develop on target systems that operate on bare-metal or OS-based framework, on an ARM or other embedded processors, with multi-threading capability Understand system requirements; software architecture; algorithm and calibration mechanisms, and be able to implement and verify software and chip/system operation Test and Debug embedded software on high-speed converter SoC using test equipment and test automation Develop test code/scripts for logical and functional test of the software. Familiarity with SW methods, C, C++ and Python programming and microprocessors is a definite plus. Deliver quality embedded system firmware with very good documentation Follow coding standards and code documentation requirements Participate in code reviews Work with IC and System Designers, FPGA Designers, Applications Engineers, and other software team members Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher in electrical, electronics, computer science or a related field Knowledge of system architectures, and Programming experience in C, Python, .NET framework. Knowledge about operating systems like Linux. Knowledge about RTOS will be a definite plus. Familiarity and/or knowledge about microprocessors. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Today’s battery market continues to be driven not by cost alone but the demand for longer range vehicles, decreased charge times, and functional safety. These exacting battery management system requirements necessitate the adherence to the highest of standards with the narrowest of tolerances. With up to 40% of the sticker price of an electric vehicle attributed to the battery, performance and battery life become major factors in an EV’s brand success. As a leader in battery management systems (BMS), Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) collaborates with customers to find the best critical processes to monitor and manage electrical vehicle batteries and ensure their safety, productivity, and longevity. The Automotive Business Unit at ADI is currently seeking an experienced electrochemist to work in the new battery testing lab. This is an opportunity to shape the future of advanced battery monitoring to make batteries safer, more economical, and more sustainable. In this position you will lead design of experiments using a combination of standard test equipment and ADI electronic demo boards on automotive grade lithium-ion batteries. The role requires setting up experiments, monitoring the cells under test, and performing preliminary analysis on data. You will be the point of contact for lab operations and coordinate with the team in scheduling experiments and work with facilities to handle aspects such as safety and logistics. Additionally, you may be required to interact with key customers in a technical capacity under the scope of joint development activities. This position requires deep technical knowledge of battery electrochemistry and degradation mechanisms. You should be proficient in the use of battery cyclers, electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, cyclic voltammetry, incremental capacity, high precision coulometry and other electrochemical analytical tools. Key Responsibilities Discuss with various teams to understand business opportunity and current/future capabilities of ADI Work closely with hardware engineers to configure inhouse electronics to measure signals from batteries Identifying key testing requirements for technology development and thereby design of experiments to collect data on large format automotive grade batteries. Collect battery lifecycle test data, perform preliminary analysis, and communicate results/insights to the team Provide Electrochemical expertise related to battery technologies, so measurement techniques can evolve to capture market value Setup and maintain battery testing lab to meet Business Needs Qualifications/Experience Phd in engineering or sciences related to electrochemistry/material science Understanding of working theory of lithium-ion batteries Experience working in battery testing lab Experience with Automotive module assembly and testing a plus Battery modelling experience a plus Knowledge on electronic circuits and ability to understand IC datasheets Python scripting knowledge highly desired Experience/knowledge with firmware coding a plus Good communications skills For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. The XTECH team at Analog Devices is developing a disruptive biological sensing platform that will transform medical diagnostics. The sensor can be applied in multiple medical end markets and applications – from lab instrumentation to cutting edge point-of-care products. XTECH has substantial market potential and strong CEO support / involvement. The XTECH team operates as a fast-paced, well-resourced start-up within Analog Devices and is comprised of seasoned medical professionals as well as highly skilled engineers and scientists. The XTECH team is backed by Analog Devices’ substantial strategic resources to help ensure its ultimate success. Your mission will be to define and execute a commercialization strategy for XTECH that realizes its substantial market potential. You will define which customers to target and determine the engagement strategies. You will lead customer negotiations in collaboration with ADI sales and ADI executives. In general, you will manage the customer relationships from initial outreach through to mass production. Through these customer engagements, you will be creating substantial new business for both Analog Devices and our customers. XTECH is a versatile technology platform. You will also be responsible for shaping the product and technology roadmap. As part of this, you will assess the market landscape and determine which existing or emerging markets we should address next. You will assess the market ecosystem to understand the basis for competition and how Analog Devices can sustain a market advantage. You will lead customer discovery activities to ensure we have a strong product-market fit. You will build go-to market plans and assess which external parties and stakeholders are required to succeed. In Your First Year, You Will Lead customers engagements with our first customers and focus on converting at least one to a viable opportunity. Lead Analog Devices through initial contract negotiations with these customers and get us to (at least) an executed MOU. Present your broader commercial strategy directly to ADI’s CEO and the senior leadership team (along with technical leadership of XTECH team). Develop an initial commercial roadmap of market and product opportunities in close collaboration with the technical team. Build out a team to support these efforts (if you deem this is necessary). For the right candidate, this is an incredible opportunity to build a new business and improve the quality of people’s lives. jobTitle: CAD Development Engineer with Emphasis on Analog Circuit Optimization Using Machine Learning
jobDescription: Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit The IC designers at Analog Devices are always pushing limits to produce industry-leading products, involving faster speeds, higher frequencies, greater precision, lower power, reduced noise, new IC technologies, increased levels of system integration, and new markets. To facilitate innovation and efficient product development, we need to continuously advance our modeling, simulation, IC CAD tools, and design methods through best in-class design automation. Our Analog/Mixed-Signal Simulation, Modeling, and CAD R&D team provides the expertise and solutions that enable our IC designers to excel. We create value by developing internal tools and methodologies that augment commercial EDA products; the team has broad and deep technical expertise to make a difference to ADI. Specific Responsibilities / Duties Projects May Include The CAD Development Engineer will research, develop, apply, and support software for the design of leading-edge analog/mixed-signal integrated circuits, with an emphasis on analog/mixed-signal/RF IC design automation, giving our IC designers a competitive advantage. Research and development of circuit optimization algorithms to improve design efficiency Apply machine learning methods to create superior solutions to design automation problems Development and deployment of automated layout generation methods targeting advanced process nodes including FinFETs Development of IP/design porting tools/methods to improve IC design execution All projects are expected to have a significant EDA software component with the expectation to contribute to all aspects of the software life-cycle including idea conception, product definition, software development, maintenance, and user support. By working closely with industry-leading analog/mixed-signal IC designers, collaborating with university researchers, and interfacing with commercial EDA tools, your work will provide leading-edge, targeted differentiation of design automation methods for ADI designers. Success is measured by the impact on IC design projects that produce great products for the customers of Analog Devices. The ideal candidate will have a sound understanding of IC design concepts and design automation algorithms with a passion for enterprise software development. Previous Experience/Skills Needed & Education Requirements MS or PhD in EE, CS, or related field Deep knowledge of machine learning/AI algorithms and techniques Python software development Demonstrable experience creating algorithms, data structures, and user interfaces for large engineering problems Good analytical, problem solving, and decision making skills. Knowledge of analog/mixed-signal IC design principles Educational and research experience related to design automation, simulation, or modeling for analog/mixed-signal/RF IC design Ability to communicate complex engineering concepts clearly and ability to collaborate effectively with other engineers Exposure to Analog layout tools and methods is preferred Experience using an analog/mixed-signal design system such as Cadence Custom IC platform is desirable Knowledge of advanced applied mathematics desirable Research experience on one of the following topics is desirable: analog circuit optimization techniques; IP process porting; machine learning methods applied to EDA problems; analog/mixed-signal design automation; device modeling for nanometer CMOS; fast, accurate simulation of large circuits on multi-core computers; efficient interconnect modeling and simulation for RF/microwave/millimeter design; power electronic circuit simulation algorithms Why You Will Like Working At ADI We place great value on individual judgment. Will work on cutting edge projects in a highly collaborative environment. We allow our employees the freedom to explore new ideas and the autonomy to determine how to best achieve business goals and objectives. We emphasize professional development and mentoring. Above all, we recognize that the personal goals of our employees and the company’s goals are closely related and must support each other. This individual will have global responsibility for a significant and critical pool of spend supporting and with exposure to all of our end markets including: industrial, automotive, digital healthcare, and high-end consumer power management markets. Context On The Role Individual will bring definitive value to the Procurement organization via analytical rigor, structured methodology to existing and new spend, market knowledge and spend leverage. Responsibilities include: Job Duties Understanding needs and requirements of internal stakeholders on current and future spend for a given category(ies) Partnering with internal stakeholders to define and develop category strategy, and approach to leveraging spend across the functional organizations Coordinating with global engineering, facilities and other functional organizations to ensure on time delivery, cost expectations Developing and managing supplier relationships, metrics and performance Providing market intelligence Leading supplier negotiations including RFP/RFQ processes, contract management, and long term strategic negotiations to obtain maximum value proposition and meeeting savings targets Recognizing and understanding supply risk to the organization, work with suppliers and internal stakeholder to resolve or suggest alternative solutions. Good problem solving and analytical skills with ability to handle multiple tasks at once and switch between strategic and detail-oriented thinking Flexibility to adapt to dynamic and rapidly changing environments Effective Communicator with the ability to work in a team environment and build strong relationships internally including cross functional and cross site collaboration Commitment to learn and develop new skills. Understanding of cost modeling and business financial acumen preferred Experience with SAP or Oracle as MRP system preferred Strong IT skills. High Proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint required. jobTitle: Chip-Package System Engineering CAD Engineer: Implementation
jobDescription: Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Position: CAD Engineer Title: Chip-Package System Engineering CAD Engineer: Implementation Manager: Nicholas Swart Project Description Analog Devices is an industry leader in the design of ICs and packaged systems. Our system products include signal-chain solutions, RF, power, MEMS, large SOC-in-package transceivers, and more. Packages used include laminates through to 3D technologies. System components can be off-the-shelf ICs, system-specific custom ICs, heterogenous “chiplet” blocks, and discrete components. IC technologies range from III/V, to BiCMOS, to high voltage nodes, to 16nm CMOS and below. Numerous design challenges arise at the system level in the areas of package modeling, chip-package co-design/optimization, system-level simulation, verification, and others. CAD tools and flows are essential in enabling these complex system-level products to be developed on schedule and with first-time success. A key area in system-level CAD is implementation, and Analog Devices’ Chip Package System Enablement (CPSE) team is seeking talented CAD engineers to work on developing industry-best-of-class chip-package system implementation tools/flows for ADI designers. Responsibilities This is a new college graduate position. The successful candidate will be part of ADI’s Chip-Package System Engineering team and will work closely with some of the world’s leading system designers to ensure the developed tools/flows have a measurable positive impact on design project success. The ideal candidate will have a sound understanding of IC design concepts. While system-level tool/flow implementation experience is not a requirement it is a plus. The candidate will work closely with commercial EDA tool vendors to apply and importantly augment their offerings, while also developing tool interfaces and/or new tools as needed. Qualifications MS in EE, CS, or related field Solid understanding of IC front to back design flows, and familiarity with relevant tools such as Cadence’s Virtuoso/VXL/VRF/DRC/LVS tool suite Understanding of system-level tools, example Cadence’s Allegro, VMT/VRF Understanding of IC-system package technologies (wire-bonded BGA, SiP, PoP, interposers, micro-bump stacking, bumpless stacking) Understanding of IP re-use and integration Analog/mixed-signal circuit fundamentals and general IC technology fluency Excellent scripting skills for tool integration and flow development and automation (Python, Perl, …) Software development competency (Skill, C++, … ) General experience with IC EDA tools and building value-add flows around such tools Allegro design methods and flows that bridge IC and package domains Assembly manufacturing product life cycle knowledge Technology deployment and administration (PDKs, rules and best practice) Design data management systems Good communication skills are an asset. You will be collecting and coordinating the EDA requirements of design teams worldwide, including future needs. You will collaborate with designers, EDA tool vendors, and possibly research institutions. You will support the worldwide introduction of design flows as well as the documentation and training of end users. Note: Applicants do not need to have experience in all the areas listed above. Motivated individuals with a solid foundation of skills developed from IC industry experience or school/internships who wish to contribute to ADI’s Chip-Package System Engineering team are strongly encouraged to apply. For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group. EEO Is The Law Education Level: Master's Degree Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time

Analog Devices, Inc. is a leading global high-performance analog technology company dedicated to solving our customers' most complex engineering challenges. We design and manufacture integrated circuits (ICs), software and subsystems and play a critical role at the intersection of the physical and digital world by providing the building blocks to sense, measure, interpret, connect, and power devices and systems. The Corporate Strategy group reports directly to ADI’s CEO & Chair and works on the highest value issues and opportunities facing the company. This position will be responsible for supporting a wide range of strategy projects that will drive growth and critical thinking. This individual will partner closely with the leadership team to broadly define business growth strategies and key enterprise initiatives, while owning the execution and monitoring of these efforts. The candidate must be a highly analytical, structured thinker, with the ability to take initiative, set strategic priorities, take ownership of assigned projects/tasks, and independently drive for results. Key Responsibilities Understand market dynamics, competitive positioning, customer/ecosystem trends, and new technologies to develop a robust, dynamic “outside in” and “inside out” perspective Partner with the executive leadership team, as well as leadership across the business units, customer office, CTO, and operations to assess business needs and define strategy Own the strategic planning process and related monthly reviews, and support and coordinate divisional planning Influence colleagues and senior management, and collaborate cross-functionally across ADI, to continue to implement vision and strategy through a strong emphasis on key enterprise initiatives and innovative growth opportunities Lead critical enterprise and business unit level projects, engaging with consulting firms when appropriate Help define inorganic growth strategy, from VC/startup ecosystem to transformational M&A, collaborating with the corporate development team on execution Provide robust program management capabilities Assist in the preparation of senior-level briefings and board materials, which involves summarizing and communicating insights at the right level from detailed analyses Balance multiple projects while providing clear thinking and excellent attention to detail in a dynamic work environment Build productive relationships with ADI’s business units, the customer office, CTO, and operations to understand their businesses and strategic objectives Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or Science related fields. MBA a plus! 5-10+ years of proven experience reflective of growing scope and responsibility Consulting, Investment Banking, Business Development, Product Management, Strategy, Marketing, Project Management, Commercial and/or Operations roles Strong strategic and quantitative data analysis skills, including advanced Excel modeling skills, with the ability to lead the development of a business plan Knowledge of the technology or semiconductor space a plus For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Description As a member of the Sales organization, the Customer Account Specialist works closely with ADI Account Managers on our most strategic accounts to proactively manage assigned customer's demand stream with ADI. The CAS supports and works with the Sales Team, Planning, Manufacturing, and the Business Units to communicate requirements and expectations for assigned accounts. The Customer Account Specialist interfaces directly with assigned customers, including face to face visits. The CAS also interfaces with the end customer's manufacturing partners and ADI Sales Teams associated with these partners globally. The CAS continually monitors revenue, backlog, forecasts, and performance to plan. This person understands customer programs that drive revenue and ensures all backend systems are aligned to support anticipated demand. The CAS works closely with Customer Service, Planning, and the Sales Team on a day-to-day basis and is a point of escalation for both the internal and external customers. Expectation is this person must be able to work independently without direct supervision driving the goals of his/her accounts on behalf of ADI. The CAS should act as an advisor to the team adding input to help resolve problems and/or achieve goals. The CAS works pro-actively to be in front of situations and notify appropriate teams ahead of issues as well as providing solutions to problems. The CAS manages all pricing needs of the customers providing quotations, managing pricing contracts, and coordinating worldwide. This includes being a focal point for contract negotiations coordinating with the contract center, providing input, and participating in face to face negotiations. Additional CAS functions include: Forecasting Revenue, Unit Forecasting (CFIT), Split / DAR Management, MSD/PRT+, Sampling, Demand Monitoring (QlikView / Drop off reports, etc.) This position requires excellent personal motivation with a proven ability to work collaboratively in a strong team environment, as well as the ability to work independently. The CAS must be multi-task oriented, flexible, positive, and able to adapt effectively to challenging and time sensitive situations. This position is located in Wilmington, MA* Qualifications Service-oriented individual with a four-year Bachelor's Degree or equivalent working experience in lieu of degree. Highly organized and detail-oriented with outstanding follow-through skills 3-5+ years’ experience in a customer-facing role, preferably in Inside Sales or External Sales, with semiconductor industry strongly preferred. Previous strategic customer experience will be heavily considered. Previous global customer and sales team experience is highly desirable. Solid understanding of manufacturing and planning processes and supply chain. Must have outstanding written and oral communication skills and presentation skills. Demonstrated ability to proactively service business with sense of accountability for positive results with a proven track record. Problem solving skills, along with demonstrated analytical skills and business acumen. Ability to proactively lead groups to speed resolution of customer problems demonstrating speed, agility, and leadership. Must have a clear understanding of a customer centric service model. Ability to work collaboratively as well as independently. Ability to perform with poise under tight deadlines and shifting priorities, as well as ability to understand independently what those priorities should be Excellent MS Office skills, especially Excel, and good data intelligence through the use of QlikView. Knowledge of SAP and other ADI tools is a plus. Additional Expectations High discipline, taking ownership, self-motivated with the ability to execute under minimal supervision Excellent time management capability Strong problem-solving capability Ability to work collaboratively as well as independently. Quick learner and willing to take challenges Travel 10% For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Analog Devices is seeking a Mixed Signal IC Design Engineer who will participate in analysis, research, design, simulation, characterization, and release-to-production of high-performance, high-speed integrated circuits, working as part of the world’s leading high-speed data converter team. The team has an excellent track record of producing breakthrough, innovative technologies including RF DACs and ADCs, based on a variety of architectures and in cutting-edge process technologies. Products have won extensive recognition in industry publications and at professional conferences. The cores developed will be integrated into products in a variety of end applications, including Automotive, Aerospace and Defense, and Instrumentation. The successful candidate must have a strong, intuitive capability in solving complex challenges. The candidate will be self-motivated and be able to work effectively within a team. Demonstrated experience working with in state-of-the-art process technologies is also highly valued. Education And Experience Requirements M.S. or Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering with experience in CMOS design Additional Qualifications Experience in converter design. While not a must, it is desirable for that experience to be with high-speed architectures, such as time-interleaved ADCs. Experience with calibration of circuit non-idealities, including linearization techniques. Consistent with application to cutting-edge technologies, this experience will likely be focused on "digitally-assisted analog" approaches. Understanding of a wide range of circuits such as wide bandwidth amplifiers and comparators, switched capacitor circuits, precision voltage and current references, LDOs. Experience in Cadence schematic capture and SPICE simulation tools. Experience with MATLAB or other modeling tools, and specifically their application to the development of calibration algorithms. Good written and verbal communication skills, and ability to work in a large team. Are you a problem solver looking for a hands-on internship position with a market-leading company that will help develop your career and reward you intellectually and professionally? Analog Devices (ADI) has just over $9 billion in revenue with offices around the world. As a global leader in the design and manufacturing of analog, mixed signal, power management and DSP integrated circuits, ADI is known for helping to solve its customers’ toughest engineering challenges. With a commitment to engineering for good, ADI strives to create a more sustainable future, while also focusing on its employees through mentoring programs, employee networks and continuous learning opportunities. At ADI, you will learn from the brightest minds who are here to help you grow and succeed. During your internship, you will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. Collaborating with colleagues in an environment of respect and responsibility, you will create connections that will become a part of your professional network. ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards. The internship program features various lunch-and-learn topics and social events with other interns and full-time employees. At ADI, our goal is to develop our interns so they are the first to be considered for full-time roles. Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible. The ADEF design charterazation and evaluatin Intern will be responsible for automated and manual rack-based lab measurements, data collection, & analysis. This will include learning and in some cases, developing, measurement and analysis techniques, software, etc. with the end goal of assisting with manufacturing release and market introduction of RF & Microwave components and SIP’s. jobTitle: Digital and Mixed Signal Design Engineering Intern
jobDescription: Are you a problem solver looking for a hands-on internship position with a market-leading company that will help develop your career and reward you intellectually and professionally? Analog Devices (ADI) has just over $9 billion in revenue with offices around the world. As a global leader in the design and manufacturing of analog, mixed signal, power management and DSP integrated circuits, ADI is known for helping to solve its customers’ toughest engineering challenges. With a commitment to engineering for good, ADI strives to create a more sustainable future, while also focusing on its employees through mentoring programs, employee networks and continuous learning opportunities. At ADI, you will learn from the brightest minds who are here to help you grow and succeed. During your internship, you will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. Collaborating with colleagues in an environment of respect and responsibility, you will create connections that will become a part of your professional network. ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards. The internship program features various lunch-and-learn topics and social events with other interns and full-time employees. At ADI, our goal is to develop our interns so they are the first to be considered for full-time roles. Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible. Design Engineer Intern Are you looking take your design skills to the next level? Look no further. When you ask your professors where to work on cutting edge analog, mixed signal, and power electronics, they will tell you Analog Devices. Why? At Analog Devices, design interns work with their mentors to explore the most challenging problems in measuring, sensing, and powering the world around us. In design projects at Analog Devices, you be responsible for finding creative solutions to currently unsolved problems and presenting your results to the senior technical staff and management. While the problems may be quite difficult, they provide an excellent opportunity to explore, collaborate, and connect theory to hands on experience. In the words of one collegiate professor “Students return to me as better engineers when they intern at Analog Devices”. Join a worldwide team of young professionals, find guidance, support to grow your unique talents and take the next steps of your education and career in design. At ADI, you’ll be mentored by the brightest minds with a shared commitment to help you learn, grow and succeed. Throughout your internship at ADI, you can accelerate your impact by working on challenging projects alongside a team of collaborative experts in an environment of respect and responsibility. Make meaningful connections who will become a part of your professional network for years to come. Enjoy a balanced work-life and enjoy various social activities involving both interns and full-time engineers. Join us on afternoons dedicated to bowling, various lunch and learns, and even an exclusive tour of our FAB lab! Here at Analog, we turn to our inside talent first for the consideration of future full-time roles. Apply to ADI today for the opportunity to grow your career and make your work day meaningful! Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Come develop technology solutions that solve planetary scale problems in the Analog Devices Battery Management Systems (BMS) business unit. The electric vehicle and green-energy revolution is here, and we are changing the world with our industry leading battery monitoring technology. From the high-performance and thrill that EVs deliver to the carbon-footprint reduction that makes the world a greener place, we are looking for more innovators in the hardware, software, and system solutions that can help to make it all a reality. Whether you are a car-lover, a battery-geek, or a technologist with a passion for a cleaner and more sustainable future, ADI BMS is a premier career destination with a bright future. This is an excellent opportunity to join a high performing team, working on digital design of the next generation of BMS chips. The designs include industry-leading low power radio transceivers, battery monitoring technology, embedded micro-controllers, and other differentiated digital and mixed signal components. The digital design team will be responsible for digital architecture planning and partitioning, collaborating with analog engineers to define mixed-signal interfaces, System Verilog and VHDL based digital design, simulation, design quality checking, design for test and test pattern generation, synthesis, floor planning, place and route, logic equivalence checking, static timing analysis, participating in chip and block level verification planning, documenting designs, and collaborating with physical validation team and applications team to support silicon evaluation and customer interactions. Locations: Beaverton (OR), Dallas (TX) Job Levels available : Engineer, Senior Engineer, Staff Engineer, Principal Engineer Minimum Qualification: BSEE/MSEE degree and experience in chip design or physical design implementation. Job level will be commensurate with experience. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Analog Devices is committed to investing in our people and their growth. One way we can do this is by establishing a cutting-edge Entry Level Hiring program. This program features high impact professional development, opportunities to drive meaningful projects that are directly tied to business goals, and unique executive exposure. Our duty is to develop the next generation of talent in our communities and provide them with a pathway to apply their academic skills in the real-world. At ADI, our early career hires will learn from the brightest minds who are dedicated to their growth, development, and success. From an industry perspective, incoming new career hires are surrounded by employees that represent the best of the best minds in their respective fields. The Advanced Cores Group at ADI develops leading-edge, high-speed, mixed-signal technology for the most demanding applications, and is looking for a digital design engineer to join the team in our Research Triangle Park (RTP) location. Our designs combine the best of analog circuit design, novel digital signal processing algorithms and embedded software to create the industry-leading data converters that enable the next generation of communications systems. The successful candidate will be responsible for the definition, design, and implementation of digital logic to calibrate mixed-signal hardware to push state-of-the-art performance. Participation will be in all phases of the design process, including requirements planning, digital architecture definition, digital implementation, and testing. The position is part of a cross-functional team and close interaction with analog/digital hardware designers, algorithm developers, software engineers, product engineers, and others is expected. The role includes collaboration with development teams at other ADI sites and may require occasional travel. Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible! Responsibilities Include, But Not Limited To RTL logic design to maximize performance of mixed-signal SoC products. Digital designs may include: Digitally assisted analog control-loop calibrations Clock management control circuitry Digital interfaces to analog functions DSP implementations of communication algorithms such as digital filters and mixers, frequency/waveform synthesis, adaptive signal processing, FFT, etc. Embedded processor subsystems for SoC products Model control-loop feedback and signal processing algorithms using tools such as Matlab, Simulink, and Python. Perform logic synthesis, timing, and power analysis to optimize digital systems Responsible for meeting timing, area, power, design-for-test, manufacturability, and schedule requirements. Pre-silicon verification utilizing both directed and constrained random methodologies at the block/subsystem/chip level. Verification may include digital and analog co-simulation of mixed signal blocks, digital and embedded software co-simulation, and/or FPGA emulation. Post-silicon validation/bring-up of designs, providing support to cross-functional teams . Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering Experience writing Verilog / SystemVerilog HDL Knowledge of DSP functions and digital filters Knowledge of Matlab and/or scientific Python programming Knowledge of C coding Knowledge of a scripting language, such as Perl or Python Strong interpersonal, teamwork and communication skills Self-motivated and enthusiastic Excellent problem solving, debugging and analysis skills Preferred Qualifications Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering Understanding of fixed-point DSP tradeoffs Experience with mixed-signal calibrations for ADCs, DACs, or SerDes Experience with the digital design flow from architecture, RTL design, verification, synthesis, place & route, power analysis, static timing closure, etc. Experience using analog and mixed-signal custom IC schematic and simulation tools. Experience with design quality checks, including linting, clock domain crossing (CDC) analysis, etc. Knowledge of verification strategies including directed vs constrained random techniques, assertions, functional coverage, formal verification, SystemVerilog UML, etc. Knowledge of ARM or RISC-V based SoC & embedded processor platforms Knowledge of common analog & mixed-signal circuits including amplifiers, PLLs, and data converters. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Digital Systems Architect Description Analog Devices is a market leader in electronic devices at “the edge”. Whether precision or high-speed data conversion, power, or isolation, our technology is ubiquitous in the chips and systems found at the boundary of the physical and digital worlds. In our unique position, we recognize our purpose to accelerate human breakthroughs that enrich lives and the world. Driven by the needs for efficiency and security and fuelled by technology innovation, we drive our customers success by combining analog, digital and software into easy-to-use solutions that transform signals into actions and insights. We lead the Intelligent Edge. The ADI Digital Business Unit (DBU) develops the digital architectures and digital system designs for a wide range of product lines. As a Digital System Architect in the DBU, you’ll work on a team which develops the system architecture of products in our micro-controller portfolio. We combine processor cores, neural nets, memory systems, peripherals, signal processing accelerators, and interfaces into digital sub-systems. You’ll define the architecture of future ASICs used to make data centers more efficient, electrify transportation, make digital and personalized healthcare possible, provide ubiquitous connectivity and communication, and create immersive consumer experiences. We’ll embed with the ADI domain experts and visit customers, working alongside world-class analog and You will be involved with the entire front-end of product development, including specification and architecture, algorithm prototyping and evaluation, behavioural modelling and RTL coding, synthesis and timing analysis closure, verification. In this role, you will collaborate with design teams at other ADI sites and with customers which will require occasional travel. Position can be located in: Colorado Springs CO, Dallas TX, San Jose CA, Beaverton, OR Wilmington, MA We are seeking a results-oriented Verification engineer to join our team focusing on development of the next generation of ADI’s Gigabit Multimedia Serial Link products delivering best-in-class solutions for in-car infotainment and advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS). Job Description Responsibilities and Duties include but not limited to: Verification of complex ASIC chips and sub-systems using leading edge verification methodologies. Employ UVM/SystemVerilog based verification methodologies and use assertions, functional/code coverage, formal verification etc. to reach verification goals. Contribute and influence the decisions on methodologies to be adopted for the verification Gate level simulations and debug of large digital blocks and full-chip ASICs Develop behavioral models for analog and mixed-signals blocks Support post-silicon validation activities of the products working with design, applications and test teams Job Requirements: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering with 2+ years of experience in digital verification. Proficient in Verilog, System Verilog, UVM, object-oriented programming, scripting and automation with Perl or Python. Firm understanding of constrained random functional verification, coverage, and assertions Experience with block and full-chip ASIC verification, regressions and coverage closure Experience with architecting verification environments and components, coverage-based validation and debug Excellent debugging, analytical and problem-solving skills Strong inter-personal, teamwork and communication skills Expected to be highly independent, proactive and result-oriented to achieve verification goals Preferred qualifications: Experience with Mixed-Signal SoC verification and wreal modeling of analog and mixed-signal blocks. Experience verifying protocols and spec compliance (e.g. I2C, UART, SPI, DisplayPort, CSI/DSI, PCIe). Analog Devices (ADI), uses the power of engineering as a force for good. We innovate to help solve the world’s biggest problems and to positively impact how millions of people live their lives. From the delivery of healthcare to helping regenerate the planet, this is how we stay ahead of what’s possible™. ADI is building a bold vision for the next decade. As part of that, we are creating an agile, multidisciplinary communications organization to tell the stories of how this vision comes to life. As true business partners, ADI’s Communications team solves complex challenges through stakeholder engagement, stellar writing, and compelling messaging and storytelling. We do this by building best-in-class communications programming grounded in data, insights, and measurable outcomes. We are looking for Director(s) of Executive Communications – As part of Global Communications, Executive Communications advises and supports ADI executives in all aspects of communication to build a strong and unique profile, as well as credibility across all target audiences. The Director(s) of Executive Communication will ensure that ADI senior leaders are communicating frequently to employee audiences, customers, and others with organizationally and geographically linked elements of our corporate narrative. As strategic counselors and can-do professionals, each will be the Communications team’s primary point-of-contact for the executive/area of the business they support. Each will help determine and shape the issues an executive (or group of executives) and will act as the “antenna and conscience” for that executive from a communications perspective, becoming a trusted counselor as well as “get-it-done” practitioner. Each Will Own And Drive Development of executive communications strategy, priorities, and execution plan in alignment with ADI’s overall strategic business objectives Collaborating with executive and their team to execute communication plans that enhance employee engagement and drive clarity and alignment to organization’s strategy and goals Be a key partner to marketing team in each area of the business to support go-to-market plans Craft authentic and tailored narratives and ensure consistent delivery of high-quality content that reflects and aligns to the executive’s unique point of view and supports executive’s strategic and tactical goals Communications derived from partnering with an executive or executives’ leadership team, identifying the need for, personally creating, and getting approvals on internal communications from that executive for global messages, videos, executive social posts, and more Help to prepare executives for internal and external opportunities including media, panels, townhalls, keynotes, earned/sponsored speaking events, and awards Crafting messaging that positions ADI executives as industry leaders via enhanced social media presence and thought leadership content Apply innovative techniques and creative ways to tell stories and determine the best way to engage with select audiences Continuously challenge and improve the effectiveness of executive communications at ADI, as well as monitor and analyze communication activities to inform decision-making Recommended Skills And Qualifications Prior experience in a communications role Proven experience working in engaging and motivating employee communications functions Experience in helping high-growth companies navigate various communications situations Comfort in a fast-paced, high-technology company A proven track record of advancing groundbreaking communication narratives through leadership Knowledge of emerging technologies, communications trends, and business skills Excellence in written and verbal communications, including the ability to present in a clear and concise manner Experience interacting with and providing counsel to C-suite executives and leaders at senior levels Have a demonstrated ability to think creatively, innovate, take ownership—and collaborate with humility Highly organized and detail oriented Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, English Literature or Communications is preferred; Master’s degree is a plus Experience as a journalist or in a media relations corporate role a plus. (While this is an internally focused role, understanding items of interest to the external media will help the incumbent know when to reach out to ADI media relations colleagues.)
