Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. The Camas Wafer Fab is a growing 150mm, high volume, 24x7 manufacturing facility, making leading-edge precision ICs in support of ADI’s diversified semiconductor business. Reporting to the Wafer Fab General Manager, the Production Director, Fab Operations will lead our ~300 employee Production team of Supervisors, Trainers, 5S & Continuous Improvement Team, New Products Technicians, Leads and Operators who execute day-to-day manufacturing, testing and shipping of our vast product portfolio as we continue to ramp, expand and modernize our facility, that has been in operation for over 25 years. Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible. Job Duties The Production Director of Fab Operations is a key member of our Camas Site Leadership Team, with the following responsibilities, aligned to 3 major competencies: Strategic Mindset Create and establish overall strategic roadmap for the Camas Production team, aligning with site goals and overall company vision for safety, quality, output, talent development and sustainability. Share and incorporate best known methods and knowledge from ADI’s internal network of factories and global leaders to better our operational execution. Demonstrate and model effective change management practices to maximize employee adoption of demand swings, new product introductions or other business opportunities. Operational Excellence Maintain a safe and healthy work environment by establishing and enforcing organization standards, following 5S principles, adhering to ADI policies, legal requirements, and regulations. Own Production Quality, promoting a zero-defect mindset through proactive quality measures, and prompt correction of quality issues and non-compliance, following 8D and 5-Why methodology based on root-cause analysis. Develop and implement production strategies to meet short-term tactical goals and long-term continuous improvement of all site metrics (Safety, Quality, Productivity and Cost). Provide tactical direction for all departments with clear communication to site personnel through detailed written reports, emails, and presentations, as well as hosting daily operational meetings, participating in all-hands sessions and attending shift stand-ups. Own and lead capacity modeling and planning activities to accurately project and perform to site output targets. Collaborate with Supply Chain to ensure that the Fab has the required wafer starts balance and schedule to meet cycle time goals and customer demand planning Participate in external and internal audits to assure standards compliance, business continuity and continuous improvement for the fab. Support development of new products and non-standard fabrication requirements, without sacrificing timely production and shipment of Camas manufactured parts. Maintain effective and evolving cross-training programs, and associated matrices. Effective Team Building Ensure our site is the local ‘Employer of Choice’ through strong recruiting, hiring, onboarding, and training of our production staff (including temporary employees) to meet staffing goals associated with quarterly moves plans. Motivate and maintain staff through proactive communication in one-on-one’s, group meetings and off-site teambuilding events, fostering teamwork and collaboration. Execute effective performance management to develop and improve team continuity and overall performance effectiveness. Display leadership skills to train, coach, and mentor production leaders to ensure that company policies, procedures and performance standards are being met. Work with Human Resources to develop and implement employee performance evaluations, competencies, technical capabilities, and skills training.   Develop, direct, and manage the production supervisors and operator population Focus and engage all teams to align with the ADI Enterprise Excellence Guiding Principles. Schedule This position is an exempt role, working on-site in Camas, Washington primarily Monday through Friday, managing reports working in a 24 X 7 continuous operation. Please do not apply if you are not able to work occasional night or weekend hours as needed. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or related field preferred. Technical/Engineering degree a plus. Extensive experience (10+ years) and expertise in high volume wafer fabrication operations. Must be able to demonstrate a solid understanding of building a team and providing training and leadership to promote a team oriented working environment. Must possess excellent communication/interpersonal skills (written and verbal) as you will be working in a data-driven team environment. Advanced level of proficiency with technology required, including familiarity with windows-based programs such as Microsoft Office products, ERP/MRP systems, dispatch and allocation software and SharePoint administration a plus. Superior problem solving, and analytical skills needed with demonstrated passion for continuous improvement and operational excellence. For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group. EEO Is The Law Education Level: Bachelor's Degree Travel Required: No

Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Director, Mixed Signal Design, Consumer Audio Solutions Analog Devices Overview Analog Devices (ADI) is a world leader in the design, manufacture, and marketing of a broad portfolio of high-performance analog, mixed-signal, and digital signal process (DSP) integrated circuits (ICs) used in all types of electronic equipment. ADI is dedicated to solving our customers toughest engineering challenges. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital with unmatched technologies that sense, measure, power, connect, and interpret. At ADI, you will both direct and learn from the brightest minds in the semiconductor industry. You will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards. Job Overview Analog Devices is seeking a Director of Mixed Signal IC Design for the Consumer Audio Solutions (CAS) Business Unit, with the primary role of leading a talented team of engineers. The Mixed Signal team is part of the CAS Design group who research, analyze, design, and simulate world-class integrated circuits. These integrated circuits enable high-volume, high-visibility devices from market leaders who require premium audio to differentiate their products to the end consumer. As a member of the CAS leadership team, you will not only manage the mixed signal design team but also help define and drive the roadmap across a wide breadth of devices. The ubiquity of connected devices as well as the form factor reduction in audio peripherals is pushing the boundaries of existing solutions, calling for novel approaches. Products range from highly integrated DSP codecs, in advanced mixed-signal process nodes, to devices like Smart Class D amplifiers at ever increasing output power levels. The successful candidate will join a team with a rich history of producing breakthrough innovative architectures for Class-D amplifiers and delta-sigma DAC’s and ADC’s, to name a few. The successful candidate must have a track record of leading successfully teams and a background of solving complex challenges. Job Location: Wilmington, MA / Austin, TX / San Jose, CA Job Description Actively manage the mixed signal design organization to facilitate the design and development of devices which meet the demanding requirements of the consumer market, in terms of complexity, development time, and solution cost Work effectively with peers in a Design organization including collaboration with digital design, design verification, and layout teams for block and system integration, and verification at chip level Participate in circuit design, chip level, and tape out reviews to ensure high quality silicon that meets the product requirements Work with product definers and marketing to convert new product ideas into commercially viable devices Translate learnings from product development into methodology changes which improve key metrics on subsequent developments Ensure Consumer Audio’s needs are addressed in company-wide IC process, Common IP, and packaging initiatives Minimum Qualifications MSEE + minimum of 15 years of relevant experience in integrated circuit, including 5+ years in a management role Hands on experience in IC design, mixed signal design flows, and relevant state-of-the art development tools Proven track record of bringing multiple integrated circuits into volume production Understanding of a wide range of circuits such as high-gain amplifiers, switched-capacitor circuits, ADCs / DACs as well as power conversion topologies Excellent communication skills and ability to work well within a multi-site cross functional team Preferred Qualifications Hands-on Audio product development experience, whether at the component or system level Expertise with Signal Processing concepts such as Digital Filters, Interpolation/Decimation and Delta-Sigma Converters Experience with high level design tools such as Matlab and Simulink Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Liaise with the sales community to increase adoption of digital capabilities by our top tier customers. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Analog Device's technology can be found at the cutting edge of new technologies that are transforming the world in automotive, communications, aerospace, industrial, healthcare and power management. This is an opportunity to contribute to innovative RF/converter-based System on a Chip (SoC) platform technology development, and to drive the key fundamental software engineering at ADI with the focus on providing complete subsystem solutions. This embedded software (firmware) engineering role resides within the Advanced Data-Converter Platforms Group (ADG) in the Aerospace and Defense Division. The goal of the ADG software engineering team is to develop and deploy production quality software and sub-system platform solutions to our customers and partners to enable them to build systems and end-products for multiple applications/segments – high-speed communications systems, programmable and flexible software-defined Radio systems, RADAR systems, and high speed/bandwidth test equipment, to name a few. These systems include both standards-based and proprietary implementations, and are deployed in civil (healthcare, industrial, automotive, consumer) as well as defense applications. This role requires an energetic and motivated individual with strong communication, organizational, and technical skills who works well in a diverse environment across a geographically-distributed organization. Key Responsibilities Architect, Design, Develop and Validate embedded modular system software and low level firmware for RF/high-speed converter front end, chips, and SoC products in C/C++. Develop and maintain Jenkins continuous integration and automated test scripts. Develop on target systems that operate on bare-metal or real-time OS-based framework, on an ARM or other embedded processors. Develop PHY layer on-chip solution for LTE and/or 5G standard. Integrate Ethernet protocol stacks into system solution. Design software system frameworks and choose components based on system requirements. Provide technical leadership for engineers throughout software development process and product life cycle, from design to delivery and support of customers. Specify process and tools for efficient development and delivery of software Deliver quality Software following coding standards with very good documentation Work in a broad, cross-functional team with IC/System Designers, FPGA Designers, Applications Engineers, and other software team members. Lead definition, build system prototypes and/or technology demonstrators to explore new technology or architecture ideas. Work with stakeholders to gather requirements. Collaborate with Software leads, QA, IC Engineering and the rest of the System and Applications Group to engage with customers to understand, define and document customer software requirements and work with our partners to further enhance our offerings in platform solutions Understand RF/high-speed converter systems and associated test equipment, including power management and drivers/power amplifiers. Become knowledgeable & develop competence in algorithms, calibration and framework system design; and become familiar with amplifiers, mixers, PLLs, filters and phase shifters. Qualifications Bachelor of Engineering degree or higher in electrical, electronics or a related field. 10+ years of embedded software development experience, embedded frameworks, and device drivers with proven track record of successful product delivery with hands-on approach. Strong software engineering skills including design, programming (C, Python or other scripting language) and debugging. Programming experience in Assembly, .NET framework and embedded RTOS is a definite plus, as is familiarity with microprocessors and related toolchains. Experience with unit testing, code coverage and associated tools. Excellent debugging skills. Good knowledge and practical experience in system software, solution architecture, software stacks and system hardware (communications, connectivity, high-speed interfaces). Knowledge of LTE, 5G protocol stacks, Ethernet protocol stacks, and practical experience in PHY layer implementation is a definite plus. Working knowledge and practical experience with high-speed converters, Digital Signal Processing, algorithms, power management, data communications, control theory, etc. Knowledgeable of system architectures and platform concepts, software development processes, and quality management systems. Experience meeting relevant qualifications/approvals/ standards. Ability to interact effectively with customers. Ability to develop, document, rationalize and present system requirements to a diverse audience of engineers. Ability to work simultaneously on multiple projects and set priorities to deliver on schedule. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, tailored for audiences from internal teams to customer deliveries. The Successful Candidate Will Have The Following Attributes Innovative, analytical problem-solver with curiosity and interest to develop on leading-edge embedded hardware and applications, and a bias to action. Flexible and self-directed with a track record of delivery of leading-edge software products. Team player, ability to work with diverse engineering teams, with wide-ranging backgrounds, cultures, and geographies. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. The Analog Garage is a high-energy, fast-paced advanced R&D team within Analog Devices (ADI) which develops ground-breaking products at our downtown Boston location. Its mission is to identify and develop new technologies, capabilities, and business models critical to Analog Devices’ future success. The projects we work on span several exciting domains including artificial intelligence, robotics, 3D imaging, green energy, human-machine interfaces, advanced bio-sensors and more. As an Emerging Business Manager in the Analog Garage, you will lead strategy formation and drive commercial execution around a series of emerging technology projects. Your ultimate objective is to commercialize and scale these new technologies – creating new businesses for Analog Devices. You will drive strategy and decision-making in all project phases: new project selection, early R&D, MVP design, go-to-market, and business scaling. And you will work with R&D teams to decide which features or performance attributes are most likely to determine project success. Many of our projects are done in tight collaboration with internal ADI business units (BUs). Building solid relationships with these teams and understanding their business, applications, and customers are critical to the Garage’s success. In many cases, you'll be working closely with these groups to align on commercialization strategy and paths to market. Activities You'll Be Driving Include You will be expected to synthesize, communicate, and execute strategic plans for the projects you'll be running. Conducting customer discovery to understand established and emerging customer needs Researching industry, technology and application trends Assessing the competitive landscape and how it is evolving Defining our value proposition and how we sustain an advantage Analyzing the ecosystem and defining partnership opportunities Planning our path to market and commercialization Collaborating and coordinating with teams across the company while building support for your strategic plans and vision In your first year, you will develop a complete business strategy for a new Analog Garage project. Additionally, you'll also take business ownership of 2-3 existing projects and will continue to execute and evolve the business strategy associated with these projects. Visit Position Overview The Electronic Test and Measurement group is seeking a Graduate Analog/Mixed-Signal Design Engineer to join our Wilmington, MA team. We produce innovative analog-to-digital converters (ADCs) that push the envelope on power consumption, precision, noise performance, and solution size to solve our customer’s hardest problems. Our team of analog and mixed-signal designers, layout engineers, and design verification engineers create highly complex integrated solutions that enable innovations in a wide variety of applications. Our parts find homes in systems ranging from automated test equipment to scientific instruments and optical communications. Job Duties A successful candidate will be responsible for transistor-, block-, and system-level precision integrated circuit design, simulation, and verification. Visit About Our Team For 20 years, the Wireless Platform Group of Analog Devices has developed Software Defined Radio solutions for cellular telephone base stations. From 1G to 5G, our market-leading customers have depended on our designs to launch their most advanced products. Every day your cellphone most likely connects through our radio products. Analog Devices is organized as business units such as WPG, each assigned a market to service, with control of R&D decisions and the responsibility to return a profit to ADI. As our team has grown, maintaining our aggressive entrepreneurial spirit has been critical to our success. Whom We Are Looking For A digital test engineer works with mixed signal test engineers and helps design test hardware and software to ensure our products meet customer performance expectations in their cellular base stations. The demands of 5G communications require ultimate performance for linearity and signal purity at RF frequencies for both transmit and receive paths. The base station electronics are mounted on towers where weight is the critical design constraint. All cooling is passive, and our components are expected to maintain operation and performance at extreme temperatures. The test engineer uses their knowledge of electronics, physics, and digital communications to subject our products to a list of tests that will ensure operation and performance in the customer’s application. Digital test engineers use specific DFT techniques to increase the end to end testability of the IC. Who You Are You are more than just the assigned project. You’re driven by your curiosity to understand how things work – and to fix them when they don’t. When you buy a new high-tech item, you take the old one apart to see what you can learn from it before recycling it. You want to develop advanced products that will enable features for the whole world to use, and it depends on you and your team to solve numerous and unpredictable problems. You want a position so exciting and challenging that you lose track of time when working and sometimes wake up in the morning with solutions no one has ever considered. But work isn’t your whole life. You have interests outside of work and need a flexible, hybrid work schedule that allows you to work from home two days a week, fully supported and enabled by a company fully invested in the tools, equipment, and culture to make it successful. The position May Perform Some Or All The Following The Digital Test Engineering position will provide ATE test development from product conception to manufacturing release in our Wireless Platform Group. Key responsibilities include: Develop and debug automatic test pattern generation (ATPG) test methodologies like SCAN, At-speed SCAN for digital blocks of a transceiver IC. Generate and debug special tests for analyzing the performance of memory blocks of transceiver IC. Analyze and conduct tests to characterize and validate new interfaces and measure various timing specifications on digitally complex electronic components. Perform thermal and electrical tests of IC package solutions to support various interface types which aid the IC package technology selection. Develop and debug functional tests for digital block through Verilog and System Verilog pattern using automated test equipment tester software. Develop software in major ATE software platforms to test ICs on custom PCBs for interface to ATE Use statistical analysis tools and reports to analyze the yields. Participate in project development including support of design-for-testability, product qualification, and ongoing support of products in production Interface with design, product evaluation, process, manufacturing, quality, and marketing as the product(s) move to completion and distribution Minimum Qualifications 0-5 years’ experience with Test Development on Digital IC’s BSEE Required MSEE Preferred Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or relevant technical discipline such Computer Engineering or Electronics Engineering with ASIC design, ASIC verification, VLSI design, coursework Understanding of digital DFT techniques (SCAN, BIST, JTAG, memory BIST) Developing and debugging ATPG tests using Synopsys or Cadence tools for digital blocks Performing characterization on timing parameters of different digital I/O’s Comfortable with Verilog or System Verilog test bench writing and simulating High-level software programming in C++, TCL, LabVIEW, Perl, Visual Basic Differentiating Qualifications ASIC verification education background. Working understanding of certain IP blocks (digital filters, ARM, JESD, ethernet) Knowledge of signal processing concepts and application For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. jobTitle: Engineer, Mixed Signal Design Verification Engineering
jobDescription: Join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to create the underlying technology that enables future innovations like autonomous vehicles, automated factories, and clinical grade remote healthcare. At ADI, innovation is ubiquitous. ADI’s culture is based on a foundation of continuous learning and improvement, trusting employees to manage their time for optimal work-life balance and long-term productivity. Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Team Description The Precision Converter Team produces innovative ADC’s and DAC’s that push the envelope on power consumption, precision, noise performance, and solution size to solve our customer’s problems. Our team of analog and digital designers, layout engineers, and design verification engineers create highly complex integrated solutions that enable innovations in a wide variety of applications. Our parts find homes in systems ranging from optical communications to automated test equipment and scientific instruments. Job Duties A successful candidate will demonstrate strong knowledge of analog circuits and possess a strong foundation in digital design concepts. The candidate will be expected to undergo training in design verification and work closely with mentors to build necessary skills. The training goals will be to equip the employee to create and implement verification strategies for mixed-signal designs, including behavioral modeling of analog circuits. As the candidate is trained, they will be expected to use behavioral models to enable comprehensive, top-down, metric-driven verification of new analog and mixed-signal designs. The position is part of a cross-functional team and close interaction with analog and digital designers as well as other verification engineers is expected. Job Location: Santa Jose, California Required Skills Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field Fundamental grasp of Analog and Digital Circuit Design Experience with scripting languages like Python, Tcl, or Perl Strong knowledge of C++ and Matlab Strong interpersonal and communication skills Some experience with simulation tool suites such as Cadence or Synopsys Preferred Skills Knowledge of standard verification flows including UVM, testbench automation, coverage-based metrics Knowledge of verification languages like Verilog/ Verilog A, SystemVerilog, Verilog-AMS, System-C, etc Experience designing and modelling analog and mixed-signal circuits Why You Will Like Working At ADI We place great value on individual judgment. We allow our employees the freedom to explore new ideas and the autonomy to determine how best to achieve business goals and objectives. We emphasize professional development and mentoring. Above all, we recognize that the personal goals of our employees and the company’s goals are closely related and must support each other. Visit Analog Devices is seeking a Product Applications Engineer within the Wireless Platform Group to focus on integrated transceiver products. This group develops highly integrated RF transceiver products for 2G to 5G cellular base stations, instrumentation & defense applications and a broad array of software defined radio applications. The applications team is focused on addressing customer needs and supporting product roll-out globally. The primary responsibility of this position is to work directly with other product applications engineers, product engineering, production test, marketing, sales, and field applications engineers to enable customers to move fast with transceiver based designs and ensure a positive customer experience. Ability to solve complex problems through design of appropriate experiments and analysis of complex data Ability to interact effectively with team members and customers Ability to work simultaneously on many projects and set priorities Team player, very good oral and written communications skills For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Visit Position: Product Applications Engineer (Engineer, Product Applications (NCG)) The Advanced Data converter platforms Group (ADG) within Analog Devices, Inc. is hiring a Product Applications Engineer. This group develops ultra-wideband integrated transceiver products for aerospace & defense, instrumentation and communications infrastructure markets, supporting applications such as radar, 5G, Satcom, smart phone testers, etc . The team is focused on addressing customer needs and supporting product roll-out globally. The primary responsibility of this position is to work directly with other applications, IC/Chip, software, product, production test, marketing, sales, and field applications engineers to enable customers to quickly understand, adopt and deploy end products with transceiver-based designs and ensure a positive customer experience. The Product Applications Engineer will support customers by phone, email, and on-site visits to present information, answer questions, and debug customer issues. Additionally, the Product Applications Engineer will write documentation that describes silicon functionality, firmware, and software operation to customers. System hardware design and implementation; laboratory measurements and experimentations; functional and performance testing; analog and digital circuits and systems innovation will be part of the responsibility and contribution of the Product Applications Engineer. The Product Applications Engineer will create and deliver presentations to customers as well as Field Applications Engineers highlighting the capabilities of the product. They will collaborate with the marketing team to engage with customers to understand, define and document customer system requirements. Responsibilities Possess data converter expertise and experience in applying converters and associated components in ultra-wideband RF signal chains Understand ultra-wideband RF systems and associated signal chains including interfaces to FPGAs / ASICs Design sub systems with electronics components including amplifiers, mixers, PLLs, analog and digital filters, RF matching, data converters, etc. Analyze, Test and Debug transceiver evaluation systems using lab test equipment and by writing test code. Provide basic FPGA support for customer design-in Support customers with software level integration of ultra wideband transceivers in customer systems. Write documentation that describes silicon functionality, firmware, and software operation to customers. Travel to worldwide customers and other ADI sites as needed Strong English communication skills are essential so that the successful candidate can Interact with, present to, and/or be trained by global teams Key Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher in electrical engineering or a related field, MS preferred Team player, quick learner, excellent oral and written communication skills. Working knowledge of RF, data converter technology & architectures Strong fundamentals in high speed analog and digital circuits, and radio signal chain Familiarity with the role of key RF design specifications (such as IIP3, Noise Figure, etc.). Programming experience in languages such as C, Python and Matlab Familiarity with DSP algorithms (i.e. equalizer, QEC, FIR filters etc.) and/or FPGA programming experience is a plus Good circuit debugging skills and proficient with lab equipment such as signal generators and analyzers, oscilloscopes and power sources Ability to interact effectively with customers and other teams Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time Location: North Carolina, USA For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Precision Converter Product Applications Engineer We are growing our Precision Converter Applications Engineering team. The Electronic Test & Measurement Product Development team develops leading edge precision analog front end solutions for Instrumentation, Industrial, Automotive, Healthcare, Communications and Consumer applications. We are seeking candidates who are open minded, have core technical knowledge and interest in developing breakthrough products. The applications role is about making it as easy as possible to adopt our products and signal chains. This role will be about delivering the application knowledge which allows ADI to think like the customer. The Role Drive positive customer engagement activities in the development of new products Create innovative new products which solve the toughest problems and are easy for customers to use. Work as part of a multi-disciplinary team (Marketing, Design, Test & Evaluation, Field Applications/Market Segment) to engage closely and deliver to our customers. Participate in design-in efforts for assigned released products Implement first class customer design-in support. Understand the customer needs and application. Provide innovative, practical and timely solutions to customer issues. Work with field colleagues or directly with the customer to solve these issues and clearly direct communicate the solutions. Create tools that make it faster and easier for our customers to design-in our products. Product development at ADI is a team game. You will work within a cross-discipline team to efficiently bring new products to market acting as the customer advocate. Developing your system and customer knowledge allows the team to make informed, evidence-based decisions. Customer awareness of our technology, products and solutions is critical in a competitive market. Create technical media (Datasheets, Application Notes, Circuits from The Lab, videos, technical seminars/webinars and trade press articles that promote awareness effectiveness and ease of use of our products. Make our differentiation and value clear in these media. The business of ADI is international. Developing a relationship with our Field Application Engineers, Sales Engineers and distributors via key training material creation and delivery helps us to reach the broad customer base. The role requires delivery of both on-site and webinar based technical training. Developing system level understanding in relevant application segments is crucial. Be open to learning every day. Understand the customer system issues with a view to defining value-added solutions and play a contributing role in defining strategies for those application segments. The Person The successful candidate will possess a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or an equivalent professional qualification, with 0- 2+ years of experience in similar industry/business. Core electronics fundamentals in both analog and digital domains. Experience in embedded microcontrollers and creating data acquisition subsystems is an advantage. Communication with our customers and our sales/field applications engineers requires an outgoing personality with a pleasant, professional and self-driven manner. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, are a key requirement. Working well within a team – both the product development and within the applications team is a necessity. The role is primarily hardware-based. Proficiency in software is desirable for complete systems understanding and design-in tool development e.g. Python, C, LabVIEW, C# are all beneficial. Showing an ability to solve complex problems, debug systems and replicate/deliver solutions on bench in hardware and software is a distinct advantage. Each day will bring new and differing challenges. As the job requires constant communication with customers, it will, therefore, necessitate travel within Europe as well as the US, and Asia. For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Product Applications Engineer Job Description Analog Devices Inc’s Wireless Platform Group is seeking versatile and motivated Product Applications engineer to join our wireless platforms team. Possessing advanced and practical knowledge of wireless radio architecture, and integrated circuit capabilities, you will work with ADIs team of system hardware engineers, system architects, technology teams, and lead customers to develop, validate and provide customer support for system platforms that demonstrate ADI’s industry leadership and technology in 4G, 5G and O-RAN solutions. The Applications team is focused on addressing customer needs and supporting product roll-out globally. The primary responsibility of this position is to work directly with other Product Applications engineers, product engineering, production test, marketing, sales, and field applications engineers to enable customers to move fast with transceiver-based designs and ensure a positive customer experience. The Product Applications Engineer will create and deliver presentations to customers, support customers by phone, email, and on-site visits to present information, answer questions, and debug customer issues. Additionally, the Product Applications Engineer will write documentation that describes silicon functionality, firmware, and software operation to customers. The Product Applications Engineer will collaborate with the marketing team to engage with customers to understand, define and document customer system requirements. The Successful Candidate Will Be Required To Understand RF systems and associated communications system designs from analog to digital including familiarity with RF analog components, A/D or D/A converter and digital front-end functions like DPD/CFR, etc. Understand the role of key RF design specifications such as EVM, Noise Figure, basic modulation techniques, etc. Test and debug ADI SoC evaluation systems using lab test equipment and by writing test code Create system models demonstrating how the Analog Devices product functions in the system Debug API and software integration issues with customers Travel to worldwide customers and other ADI sites as needed Strong communication skills are essential so that the successful candidate can Interact with, present to, or be trained by teams worldwide Qualifications Bachelors degree or higher in electrical engineering or a related field One to two years relevant work experience Familiarity with communication system and architectures, basic knowledge on each block function and impairment, associated system simulation or design experience is preferred Circuits knowledge that includes one or more of the following: analog circuits, RF circuits, signal and systems, A/D&D/A converter, wireless communications and digital signal processing knowledge and related algorithms is preferred Knowledge on software architecture, design flow. and associated programming experience in C,C# or Python is preferred Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to solve complex problems through design of appropriate experiments and analysis of complex data Ability to interact effectively with team members and customers Ability to work simultaneously on many projects and set priorities Team player, very good oral and written communications skills For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Job Description Analog Devices Inc. is seeking an intelligent and versatile product engineer to join our industry pioneering radio transceiver design group. You will join a team of digital, analog and mixed signal CMOS designers, algorithm and software developers implementing state of the art RF transceiver chips that change the world as we know it. As a member of Product engineering team, you will be responsible for a specific product or group of products from product definition through production and release. Product Engineer will participate in pre-silicon system development emulations, verification of pre and post tape out. There are huge variety of tasks a product engineer can get involved in either software algorithm validation, digital, RF, analog evaluation etc. Key Responsibilities Include Interface as the central resource with design, test, application, software and marketing teams as the product(s) move from design to completion and distribution. Evaluation of new silicon and software, working with a multi-functional team to identify, simulate, and lead system solutions for transceiver products. Verification & release of embedded software for transceiver products. Verification of Digital, DSP & Analog features. Perform RF measurements. Responsible for taking silicon and ARM software from early development stage to full production release. Responsible for developing and operating automated software verification test bench using LabVIEW & TestStand. Direct interaction with applications/marketing as well as customers to resolve product issues. May participate in customer visits. The role of the Reliability Engineer is to plan and execute stress test plans to de-risk or validate new product designs and technology platforms. Working in a team environment, testing plans may include intrinsic reliability characterizations, new package robustness evaluations, or advanced look ahead studies to draw out new mechanisms. Qualification plans for new or re-designed products, processes and packages are also developed. The Reliability Engineer also assists in the root cause analysis of qualification failures and drives appropriate corrective and preventive actions using structured problem solving methods. Sustaining support for current products would include risk assessments of any field events. Key Duties Of The Reliability Engineer Developing qualification plans, reliability evaluations, and risk assessments in a timely manner. Application of physics of failure models with regards to intrinsic semiconductor device level reliability e.g. TDDB, EM, EM and BTI Performing reliability statistical calculations, such as MTTF, MTBF, FIT, and failure rate modeling Progressing a product/technology through the product development cycle. Assisting in or developing Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) or other assessments based upon a structured risk evaluation methodology Leading structured problem solving teams using six sigma methodologies, such as 8D Communicating and interpreting qualification requirements within a cross-functional environment. Identifying and planning for application specific mission profiles Supporting internal/external customers with general reliability related inquiries. Qualifications/Skill Set BS EE, Materials, Physics, or related field; Master's Preferred. Semiconductor industry experience in packaging, wafer fabrication, design, or device physics a plus. Proficient in technical writing, project management and independent research Continuous improvement mindset Exposure to Six Sigma Green/Black Belt methodologies For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Consider the possibility of being part of an elite team of talented, eccentric developers residing within a semiconductor company. We solve real problems that intersect the physical world so that at the end of the day you have some thing to show for your hard work. If you love writing software, solving crazy hard problems, and don’t mind being different than your peers then you might like working here. In fact, we have several team members who have been coding since middle school. Analog Devices might sound like a place that has nothing to do with software, but this is absolutely not the case! In this position you will be developing tools for state-of-the-art software-defined radios. These tools take on many forms – GUIs, DSLs, frameworks, libraries, system solvers, scripts, enhanced CI/CD systems, etc. Language technologies vary from C/C++ to Python to C# and others. The subject matter is largely data converters and signal processing. Having expertise in these areas is strongly preferred but not required. Our team passionately wants to delight our customers with world-class evaluation and development experiences which are distinguished in our industry. What good is having state-of-the-art hardware if you don’t have state-of-the-art software? Then again you might prefer the alternative. You could apply for a major software company. You might even pass the interview process with flying colors. What then? You’ll spend the rest of your life trying to differentiate yourself, proving your value as a top-notch developer just like the other 30 bazillion rock star hot-shot ninjas on the West Coast. You decide. The interview starts now! Let Fib(n) be the string formed by concatenating the first n sequential Fibonacci numbers (i.e. Fib(0) = 1, Fib(1) = 11, Fib(2) = 112, …). Find the first ten-digit prime number that occurs as ten sequential digits in Fib(n). Go to http://{prime number}.com to proceed with the interview. Title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer Location: MA-Boston Analog Devices is uniquely positioned for success at the boundary of the physical and digital worlds. Analog Devices transforms physical phenomena – sound, light, radio waves, voltages, currents, and motion – into high fidelity data. Our mission is to build the Intelligent Edge where AI transforms the way we solve challenging problems by combining deep application knowledge, close customer relationships, extraordinary data, advanced circuits, and breakthrough algorithms. Analog Devices has established the AI Solutions Business Unit to deliver AI-enabled products to the vast array of markets we serve. The AI Solutions BU develops products at multiple layers of the technology stack, from AI-enabled software application to deeply embedded AI algorithms. The AI Solutions BU collaborates with our Market BUs to solve problems beyond the reach of pure semiconductor, circuit-level, or architectural innovation. Lead Embedded Software design for Intelligent Edge. You will collaborate with System Architects, Product Manager, Algorithm Designers, Software and Hardware Engineers to take high-level system architecture and translate into working design. You will take full ownership of design, test, documentation, and maintenance of embedded software of Intelligent Edge. You will divide the workload to sub-tasks and delegate those to junior engineers. You will act as mentor and technical supervisor to junior members of the team. Intelligent Edge Software will typically run embedded Linux (can also run FreeRTOS or other operating systems) and might include APIs, state machines, communication bus controllers and hardware self-tests, ‘bare-metal’ MCUs (ARM Cortex) and DSP blocks. You will establish and apply modern software-engineering best practices in all of your work. You will create documentation for fellow developers and users of the system. You will integrate hardware and software, bring-up and debug the system. You will collaborate with Applications Team to collect feedback from customers for continuous improvements and new features. Minimum Qualifications MSEE or MSCS degree Technical leadership experience in Embedded Software Strong C/C++ programming skills Experience using ARM development tools such as Keil, IAR, Eclipse, mBed, GCC. Experience with Linux, FreeRTOS and/or other embedded OSs Solid understanding of signal chains, sampling theorem, noise, time domain to frequency domain conversion, windowing and filtering. Solid problem-solving and trouble-shooting skills Desired Skills And Experience Knowledge of digital signal processing (DSP) and algorithm implementation experience. Experience in FPGA development including design, synthesis, simulation, verification and timing analysis. Background in ML algorithms (CNN, DNN) and experience in their embedded implementation. Solid understanding of ADC and DAC principles of operation For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Engineer, Systems Design Engineering Crossing the gap between analog and digital is essential in today's era of telecommunications. As the need for higher data bandwidths increases, the complexity of data converters, as well as the system in which they operate, grows. ADI offers high-performance data converters together with highly configurable digital signal processing in a single Mixed-Signal Front End (MxFE) SoC integrated solution. ADI's MxFEs are software-defined platforms which span the analog to digital signal processing boundary in communication (5G, satellite), instrumentation and Aerospace & Defense applications. We are looking for a highly motivated engineer who can combine software, hardware, and mixed-signal knowledge to develop, evaluate, document and communicate system-level procedures and processes (Algorithms) during pre and post silicon tapeout. The Applicant Will Be Working with IC and Systems Engineers understanding requirements for utilization, calibration and evaluation of different blocks in the MxFE. These include, but not limited to, clock distribution networks, frequency dividers, Analog-to-Digital Converters (ADCs), Digital-to-Analog Converters (DACs), Phase-Locked Loops (PPLs) as well as programmable digital filters. Responsible for designing experiments and evaluating the MxFE's blocks and system-level algorithms in the lab. Collaborating with Embedded and API Software Engineers defining, reviewing and verifying software responsible for configuration and calibration of different blocks of the MxFE. Guiding Product and Test Engineers execute and debug procedures during first-silicon bring-up and product development. Assisting and supporting Product Application and Field-Application Engineers answering customer queries or implementing customer request. Job Qualifications Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or Electrical and Computer Engineering with silicon evaluation and troubleshooting experience. Strong communication, writing and teamwork skills Working knowledge of analog signal processing topics such as filtering, phase-shifting, level-shifting, resonance, parasitic coupling, differential signaling, amplification, comparison, biasing, Fourier transform and harmonic distortion. Working knowledge of digital signal processing topics such as sampling, signal aliasing, setup/hold timing violations, mixing, up and down conversion, FIR and IIR filtering, polyphase filter implementation, interpolation, decimation, dither injection, quantization and Z-transform. Experience working with RF Analog-to-Digital and Digital-to-Analog Converters (ADC/DAC), which includes understanding of pipeline, time-interleaved and SAR architectures. Experience using electronics lab equipment such as signal generators, oscilloscopes power supplies, digital multimeters, and firmware debuggers. Experience with programming languages such as C, Python, MATLAB and Verilog. A strong candidate would have experience in Analog and Digital IC design (Cadence/Synopsys), practice in mathematical analysis of data, be eager to learn new topics, and go the extra mile to expedite product development. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit About Our Team For 20 years, the Wireless Platform Group of Analog Devices has developed Software Defined Radio solutions for cellular telephone base stations.  From 1G to 5G, our market-leading customers have depended on our designs to launch their most advanced products.  Every day your cellphone most likely connects through our radio products.  Analog Devices is organized as business units such as WPG, each assigned a market to service, with control of R&D decisions and the responsibility to return a profit to ADI.  As our team has grown, maintaining our aggressive entrepreneurial spirit has been critical to our success. Whom we are looking for A product test engineer develops tests and software to ensure our products meet customer performance expectations in their cellular base stations. If you have ever thumbed through a datasheet and wondered who collects and verifies the data used in the performance plots and specification table, that’s us. The demands of 5G communications require ultimate performance for linearity and signal purity at RF frequencies for both transmit and receive paths. The base station electronics are mounted on towers where weight is the critical design constraint.  All cooling is passive, and our components are expected to maintain operation and performance at extreme temperatures.  The characterization engineer uses their knowledge of radio architecture and subsystems, analog and digital communications, and RF measurement methodologies to subject our products to a list of tests that will ensure operation and performance in the customer’s application.  Who you are You are more than just the assigned project.  You’re driven by your curiosity to understand how things work – and to fix them when they don’t.  When you buy a new high-tech item, you take the old one apart to see what you can learn from it before recycling it.  You want to develop advanced products that will enable features for the whole world to use, and it depends on you and your team to solve numerous and unpredictable problems.  You want a position so exciting and challenging that you lose track of time when working and sometimes wake up in the morning with solutions no one has ever considered.  But work isn’t your whole life.  You have interests outside of work and need a flexible, hybrid work schedule that allows you to work from home two days a week, fully supported and enabled by a company fully invested in the tools, equipment, and culture to make it successful. The position May Perform Some Or All Of The Following The Product Test Engineering position will develop hardware and software for characterization and system evaluation on high volume fully automated and low volume lab bench equipment from product conception to manufacturing release in our Wireless Platform Group.  Key responsibilities include: Design (individually and as part of a team) software and hardware to characterize and production test state-of-the-art ICs Characterization of pre-release silicon encompassing the total solution including analog, digital, and firmware algorithms. Work in a design team to formulate test strategies for developing comprehensive tests ICs Use statistical analysis tools and reports oriented for validation of products to set test limits on new products and datasheets Develop verification and characterization test plans and develop the software required to automate the data collection process. Perform lab analysis and evaluation of new silicon and software, working with a multi-functional team to identify and correct functional and parametric problems. Participate in project development including support of design-for-testability, product qualification, and ongoing support of products in production Interface with design, product evaluation, process, manufacturing, quality, and marketing as the product(s) move to completion and distribution Minimum Qualifications 0-5 years experience with RF/Mixed-Signal Test Development BSEE Required MSEE Preferred  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to solve complex problems through the design of appropriate experiments and analysis of complex data Strong organizational, time management, and multi-tasking skills toward the capture of aggressive schedule demands Knowledgeable in RF measurements and signal processing  Familiarity with embedded software and verification practices.  Strong teamwork ability within multi-discipline and multi-cultural environments Successful course work in at least one of the following areas: RF circuits,  ADCs, DACs, high-speed serial interfaces, and/or microcontrollers Lab experience using bench and/or production test equipment, including spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, signal generators Working knowledge of and/or experience with LabVIEW, Python, Visual BASIC, HTML, and/or C/C++ Differentiating Qualifications RF and communication systems education background. Working understanding of RF transceivers and their different sub-blocks. (Plls, Mixers, LNAs, ADCs\DACs, JESD) Knowledge of signal processing concepts and application Strong understanding of communication systems and standard For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. jobTitle: Graduate Rotational Development Program - Field Applications
jobDescription: Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Graduate Rotational Development Program – Field Applications | Worldwide Sales, Sales Analog Devices | Wilmington, MA training. Georgia/Alabama final location. Analog Devices Overview Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) is a world leader in the design, manufacture, and marketing of a broad portfolio of high-performance analog, mixed-signal, and digital signal processing (DSP) integrated circuits (ICs) used in virtually all types of electronic equipment, dedicated to solving the toughest engineering challenges. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital with unmatched technologies that sense, measure, power, connect, and interpret. Why You Will Like Working At ADI We place great value on individual judgment. We value diversity We allow our employees the freedom to explore new ideas and the autonomy to determine how to best achieve business goals and objectives. We emphasize professional development and mentoring. Above all, we recognize that the personal goals of our employees and the company’s goals are closely related and must support each other. Position Overview Our rotation programs are a great way for you to understand different business/technology groups, practice relevant skills, and meet key connections for your future at ADI. Within the Graduate Rotational Development Program, you will be placed in a two-year long program that offers real-world experience, providing an excellent foundation for career growth and advancement. During the program, you will go through a structured, progressive curriculum including four rotations where you will receive professional development opportunities and mentorship before integration into the sales team. In addition, some skills you will develop include, but are not limited to: Analog / Mixed-Signal circuit and system design Assisting in the design and evaluation of customer systems – hardware and software Understanding and disseminating Customers' system needs versus wants Developing and maintaining relationships with customers and ADI’s product line management, marketing, and engineering Educating customers about ADI’s products, services, and system solutions through technical presentations and demonstrations Sales Integration Overview After completing the Graduate Rotational Development Program, you will enter Analog Devices’ sales organization as a Field Applications Engineer in the Georgia/Alabama region as a Field Applications Engineer, you will work collaboratively with our sales team to engage our customers, understanding and solving their most challenging application-level problems that span a broad range of technologies including data conversion, sensing, interface, communication, processing and security. What You Need To Be Successful In This Role Experience with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, along with soldering and debugging skills Solid analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery Ability to build lasting, influential relationships, internal and external Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and changing environment Ability to take initiative and drive for results Ability to influence decisions through a sense of urgency and competitive drive Requirements Bachelor’s in Electrical Basic understanding of schematics, layouts and electronic components Knowledge and understanding of analog, mixed-signal, or digital circuitry (e.g., sensors, op-amps, DC/DC power, data converters, processors, etc.) Ability to travel 25-35 % of time Flexibility and desire to relocate to the Georgia/Alabama upon completion of the development program. Information Security Risk Lead Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure, and connect. Analog Devices is looking for an Information Security Risk Lead . This person will support ADI’s risk and compliance management program. This individual will be responsible for the developing and implementing controls, aligning across multiple frameworks and regulatory requirements and monitor, and tracking of ADI’s enterprise IT Risk Program. Candidate must be a highly motivated IS Risk and Compliance professional who can work independently. Must be a self-starter and able to deliver results with minimal supervision. Responsibilities Provide subject matter expertise for all aspects of Technology risk management Lead and execute technical security risk reviews, security risk assessments and security controls testing. Perform risk-based Application security reviews and assessments and assist in recommendations for appropriate risk treatment. Documenting risk and compliance findings, root cause, and recommendations for remediation Provide support in monitoring, tracking, and reporting of risk assessment results, metrics, and remediation plans Establish, implement & track KRIs Assist in the ongoing maintenance and publishing of security policies & standards, and assist in ensuring compliance Apply current knowledge of IT trends and systems processes to identify security and risk management issues and other opportunities for improvement. Manage the evaluation and testing of IT processes and system controls and identification of areas of risk. Interpret standards, requirements, and their application to technical environment. Collaborate with technical teams to define and implement security processes and procedures to meet compliance requirements. Define requirements and validate implementation. Identifying evolving IT security protection requirements and risks inherent in cloud-based applications during the lifecycle of vendors and develop remediation plans using evolving business processes and tools Identify evolving privacy/data protection requirement and risks inherent in the Company’s operations and assist with the design and implementation of company-wide privacy/data protection processes and procedures Assist in the development and ongoing review of security policies standards, and procedures. Assists in maintaining a systematic process for managing ADI’s information security risks. Develop, perform and/or coordinate control assessment testing to ensure that Information Technology processes and controls are functioning as designed Coordinate and perform IT self-assessment compliance reviews based on regulatory, industry standards, and internal policy requirements. Assist in evaluating any related external frameworks or standards (e.g., COBIT, NIST Security and Privacy Standards, CMMC/DFARS, ISO 27001/27002, HIPAA/HITECH, TISAX, CIS Center for Internet Security Critical Security Controls (SANS 20) etc.) or internal policies/standards (e.g., code of conduct, record retention, and acceptable use, etc.) to determine the relevant IT compliance requirements and controls. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Stay ahead of what’s possible and join Analog Devices (ADI). For more than 55 years, ADI has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. This position we have you working alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from democratizing electrification, enabling the metaverse, bridging the digital divide and leveraging space for sustainable industrial growth. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the centre of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analogue and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Integrated Marketing Associate, Communications & Cloud We are looking for an Integrated Marketing Associate to become part of our Corporate Marketing (CM) team. The ideal candidate will have the ability to elevate product messaging up to larger corporate narratives, use data analytics to help charter next actions, report on ROIs for various marketing initiatives, and have prior knowledge of the Communications market. Experience with 5G technologies and/or working within a product line are pluses. The chosen candidate will join our team to aid in expanding our market leading business position by working in partnership across various product lines – translating business objectives into a marketing strategy with tactics and measurable metrics. Our chosen candidate will have strong organizational and interpersonal skills, a proven ability to define and measure what success looks like, be highly motivated to drive actions and assignments to closure and an understanding of how to cooperate with business lines toward aligned goals. Responsibilities The position will include accountability for the following as it pertains to the Communications Business Unit (BU) at ADI. Work across various areas of the organization to ensure that objectives, and associated tactics, of the CM department are aligned with goals of the Communication BU. Serve as the main point of contact, from the BUs, into the entire CM organization. Work with upper management to review, and refine, core marketing messages which align to the overall ADI brand image. Assist upper management in their preparation for key industry speaking opportunities. Collaborate with sales and BU stakeholders to ensure a robust customer funnel with best-in-class migration rates and marketing-generated revenue streams. Define, manage, drive, and measure the effectiveness of go-to-market strategies (AKA, marketing campaigns) across the Communications product portfolio and market. Approve and track to budget marketing expenditures. Utilize, and influence, the data analytics team to provide better customer insights. Report back to the BU regarding campaign effectiveness and contribution to overall goals. Help build/manage a network of reliable external agencies and marketing professionals to supply marketing services, as required. Requirements Strong candidates will have the following experiences and qualifications: Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Business, Electrical Engineering or equivalent 5+ years in related strategic marketing, business development, product marketing, applications, or systems role Demonstrated strong business acumen with awareness of best marketing and campaign planning practices Experience with understanding and articulating technical concepts and value propositions Experience elevating the marketing message beyond product positioning Demonstrated leadership skills and self-starter mindset Ability to work across a large organization and diverse teams Competent in MS Office Suite including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Strong interpersonal and presentation skills Ability to travel for partner and customer meetings as required Beneficial Skills Exceptional candidates will have the following experiences and qualifications: An MBA degree with related concentration in marketing Experience working in Semiconductor industry Experience working in, or supporting, the communications industry Ideal candidate will have earned a bachelor’s EE degree combined with an MBA and marketing concentration Track record of working cross functionally with business units, digital/ecommerce, ecosystem partners and sales For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group. Education Level: Master's Degree Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time
