Are you a problem solver looking for a hands-on internship position with a market-leading company that will help develop your career and reward you intellectually and professionally? Analog Devices (ADI) has just over $9 billion in revenue with offices around the world. As a global leader in the design and manufacturing of analog, mixed signal, power management and DSP integrated circuits, ADI is known for helping to solve its customers’ toughest engineering challenges. With a commitment to engineering for good, ADI strives to create a more sustainable future, while also focusing on its employees through mentoring programs, employee networks and continuous learning opportunities. At ADI, you will learn from the brightest minds who are here to help you grow and succeed. During your internship, you will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. Collaborating with colleagues in an environment of respect and responsibility, you will create connections that will become a part of your professional network. ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards. The internship program features various lunch-and-learn topics and social events with other interns and full-time employees. At ADI, our goal is to develop our interns so they are the first to be considered for full-time roles. Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible. The Internship program at ADI provides young professionals with the opportunity to gain professional experience within an innovative and global company. ADI’s long-term goal is to convert an intern into a full-time employee. The University Relations Team continually strives to accomplish this goal year-after-year by establishing a well-equipped program (virtual and in person) that focuses on growth, company culture, and mentorship, coupled with a collaborative work environment and passion for innovation. On average, each year, ADI converts roughly 70%-80% of their interns into full time hires! ADI provides a high-quality internship program that the company has consistently been known for. These events revolve around the cross collaboration with peers and include executive speakers, lab tours, development events, social events, and community service opportunities. Our Intern Program provides opportunity for interns to collaborate and learn, drive results, and grow their professional network. Apply now for the opportunity to start your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible! The Manufacturing Applications team is seeking a motivated Software and Systems Intern to support our Manufacturing Site IT Group team located at ADI’s Wilmington Site. The Wilmington Site IT Group supports the Wilmington Manufacturing Wafer Fab organization’s IT needs, including Application Development, System Administration, Data Visualization, and Equipment Automation. The Manufacturing Applications team develops and supports custom web applications to improve access to data, streamline operations, and improve communication throughout the manufacturing organization, and is looking for an intern with strong self-direction and great communication skills to assist with development, testing, implementation, and documentation. Responsibilities Include, But Not Limited To Documenting existing libraries / shared code Identifying opportunities for standardization and reduction of code base Assisting team with generating and reporting performance metrics Configuring and deploying applications into the Manufacturing Organization Developing prototype applications based on expressed needs Minimum Qualifications Pursuing a degree in Engineering or Computer Science Experience with PHP programming Proficient in web development (HTML/CSS/Javascript) Experience with Linux, including troubleshooting issues Preferred Qualifications Experience with other web development / scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby Experience with Visual Studio / Visual Basic development (to support Automation team) Familiar with SQL Databases For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group. EEO Is The Law Education Level: High School Diploma/GED/Leaving Certificate Travel Required: No

Analog Devices transforms physical phenomena – sound, light, radio waves, voltages, currents, and motion – into high-fidelity data. Our mission is to build the Intelligent Edge, where AI transforms how we solve challenging problems by combining breakthrough algorithms, data, advanced circuits, deep application knowledge, and close customer relationships. Analog Devices has established the AI Solutions Business Unit to deliver AI-enabled products to the broad array of markets we serve. The AI Solutions BU develops products at multiple technology stack layers, from AI-enabled software applications to deeply embedded AI algorithms in our silicon. The AI Solutions BU collaborates with our Market BUs to solve problems beyond the reach of pure semiconductor, circuit-level, or architectural innovation. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Analog Devices innovations in digital cabin experience, electrification, automated driving solutions, and power management help our customers design safer, greener, and more comfortable automobiles. Broadband communications systems rely on ADI: virtually every wireless call, text, and download today passes through an Analog Devices IC. Our broad portfolio provides high quality, reliable, and cost-efficient solutions for point-to-point communications systems, private mobile radios, and wireless infrastructure equipment. Today’s advanced defense systems in radar, communications, avionics, defense electronics and much more demand the best in system level performance and security. Analog Devices has a rich history of delivering system-level solutions to enable critical missions in the unforgiving vastness of space. ADI have a distinct technical and system-level experience which enables customers get to market faster. As Analog Devices looks to accelerate its organic growth trajectory and expand its marketing capabilities in the markets served, it must invest in top-tier marketing talent to lead these growth efforts. The Managing Director, Marketing will be able to collaborate and thrive in a global environment, provide innovative marketing and communication approaches and champion change. Key Responsibilities The Managing Director, Marketing reports directly to the Chief Marketing and Digital Transformation Officer and is responsible for leading, managing and directing all the marketing related activities. He/she will work with the cross-functional leadership team to identify and execute plays that will lead to growing revenues in existing and new markets by leveraging strong marketing to maximize the growth, development and return on investment of the organization’s product portfolio today and in the future. He/she will be responsible for development and driving strategic marketing initiatives that result in accelerated growth across the portfolio of business units. Oversee and enhance voice of customer in all marketing programs with strong “customer success” orientation. Set and build a marketing vision that is embraced throughout the organization, which will include establishing credibility at all levels; bringing best practice approaches; cultivating a high performing marketing organization and developing talent. Own marketing talent development, with a focus on developing a robust succession pipeline. Lead and partner cross-functionally in service of the customer journey by building trust, accountability and breaking down silos across the organization to lead beyond Marketing. Create and set a marketing vision and strategy to take it to the next level and begin executing on that vision. Align marketing efforts with the organization’s strategic priorities and link to business results. Assess current team skill and structure; making changes as necessary to create meaningful outputs from an optimized, fully aligned, engaged, synchronized team. Achieve marketing influenced revenue and customer growth targets. He/she must be a hands-on person who possesses the best combination of strategic thinking and drive to achieve tangible business results. The successful candidate will have a keen ability to seek the ideas of multiple individuals in the organization and help facilitate the best path forward for the segment in strategic decisions. Has track record of successfully leading digital marketing functions and delivering top results. Group Lead, Seal And Environmental Test Analog Devices Federal LLC is looking for an experienced Hybrid Module Assembly Process Engineer responsible for improving and maintaining processes in the manufacture of complex microwave and millimeter wave electronics. This position will manage a small team of process engineering technicians. As an Analog Devices Process Engineer, you will join a team that is responsible for developing and optimizing assembly manufacturing processes to achieve the output, quality, and cost goals of the organization. Process Engineers are responsible for monitoring and controlling component and module product performance; managing tool productivity and maintenance; conducting data analysis to improve processes, developing and implementing statistical process controls, providing sustaining engineering support of unit processes and disposition of material, and managing and driving continuous improvement activities. This role also ensures that stress and other environmental testing meets the testing standards are required by our customers. This is a hands-on position that requires a strong ability to work on a suite of complex automated and manual manufacturing equipment. Together as a team, you’ll take a demanding set of functions and turn them into products that enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with technologies that sense, measure, and connect. Developing and optimizing manufacturing processes to support scaling to high volume production. Understanding product testing requirements as defined by our customers Standardizing manufacturing processes and procedures in computer-aided manufacturing system (MES) Troubleshooting Process and Equipment manufacturing issues and implementing robust corrective actions Disposition of production materials on hold and taking action to troubleshoot process and equipment issues for predicable operations. Working with development engineering to implement new processes in support new product integration. Collaborate with design staff to develop new processes and ensure compatibility with current processing methods. Drive continuous improvement projects to minimize processing issues and improve productivity. Qualify new tools for production, including documentation, training, and certification of operators/technicians. Programming of computer-controlled equipment and vision recognition systems. Respond to internal and external customer requests or events as they occur Qualifications BS/MS in Electrical/Mechanical/Chemical Engineering, Physics, Material Science, or related technical discipline Experience in electronics assembly and manufacturing including packaging/sealing and leak testing, and familiarity with wire bond, die attach, lead forming, and surface mount technologies Coursework in statistics and other related subjects Prior experience working in a semiconductor cleanroom environment. Strong analytical mind with problem solving skills. Understanding and knowledge of Statistical Process Control (SPC) and Design of Experiments (DOE). Ability to work effectively and efficiently with diverse teams; customers; internal and external partners. Experience managing a team preferred Highly motivated and is passionate about the job. Position Overview Analog Devices Inc., Chelmsford Massachusetts facility is looking for Manufacturing Assembly Associates to support our continued growth in the manufacture of high-performance microwave modules and sub-systems. Customers trust Analog Devices to deliver integrated electronics and ADI is interested in energetic and organized team players that want to deliver quality products in a high-tech manufacturing environment. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Mechanical Engineer (NCG) At Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI), we enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. ADI is a world leader in the design, manufacture, and marketing of high-performance analog, mixed-signal, and digital signal processing (DSP) integrated circuits (ICs) used in virtually all types of electronic equipment. Used by over 100,000 customers worldwide, our signal processing products play a fundamental role in converting, conditioning, and processing real-world phenomena such as temperature, pressure, sound, light, speed, and motion into electrical signals to be used in a wide array of electronic devices. ADI’s Aerospace and Defense (ADEF) Module and Subsystem group designs RF/Microwave products ranging from 1GHz up to 70GHz for commercial, military, and space applications. Products include receivers, transmitters, low spur/phase noise synthesizers (DDS and indirect), high-power GaN amplifiers, and multifunction modules. ADI’s Aerospace and Defense business has an open position for a Mechanical Engineer who will design cutting-edge integrated modules and subsystems. You will work in a collaborative team environment and interface with electrical designers, process engineers, program managers, and production assembly through all program phases from research through design and production. Principal Job Responsibilities Include Design innovative mechanical packaging solutions for complex multi-chip assemblies, using both chip-and-wire and SMT technologies, working in close collaboration with RF and digital engineers. Design detailed housing assemblies for highly-integrated, mixed- technology systems. Design systems which incorporate RF modules, control electronics, power systems, cabling and cooling. Static and transient thermal analysis from the IC gate level to rack-sized systems. System level structural analysis to ensure reliable operation over wide ranges of environmental conditions. Oversee preparation of design and fabrication documentation. Work with suppliers and our factory on product build and test. Prepare design review documentation packages for presentation at customer design review meetings. Participate in internal and external design reviews. Proposal research and preparation including cost and schedule estimates. Envision and develop innovative new materials, components or processes to advance design capabilities into new markets. Qualifications New graduate with a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering. Master’s degree preferred. Previous intern experience or exposure to RF and microwave electronics or high-reliability products is a plus. Requires strong organizational and planning skills, technical curiosity, and desire to proactively grow in the role. Proficient with solid modeling and FEA analysis tools such as ANSYS. U.S. citizenship or permanent residency required. For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Title: Mechanical System Design Engineer – Co-Op/Intern Position Description The mechanical system design engineering co-op position is an opportunity to be part of team working on “Ahead of What’s Possible” technologies that bridges real analog world around us and the digital cloud. Candidates Are Be Expected To Have This position is designed to provide an immersive experience in mechanical system design that makes use of semiconductor IC chips to create systems and modules. These modules are designed to solve unique problems in healthcare, automotive, or industrial applications. It requires students to follow hands-on method of learning and participate in development of state-of-the-art system’s solutions for semiconductor devices. Student will get an opportunity to work on design of 3D CAD models, characterizations to understand design tradeoffs between manufacturability, reliability, and time-to-market. Working knowledge to generate CAD models (AutoCAD or Solidworks). Communication skills to work senior engineers developing 3D systems’ models and performing design-manufacturability tradeoff characterizations. Learning mindset to perform destructive physical analysis and competitor teardowns using cross-sections, lapping, and decapsulation, and high magnification optical microscopy. Motivated to learn analytic tools such as x-ray, acoustic microscopy, and scanning electron microscopy when needed Ability to collate information with appropriate supporting data and present into a coherent report for communication and distribution. Eligibility Rising senior in undergraduate mechanical or biomechanical or electrical engineering. Master’s candidates with relevant skills may be considered. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Regulatory Operations Engineer – Healthcare Group The growth and demand in the healthcare market has and will continue to grow exponentially. ADI is well positioned to leverage its core sensor and signal processing technology to take advantage of this growth. We are looking for an energetic and experienced Medical Devices Regulatory Expert who can guide the advanced systems and technologies being developed at ADI through the regulatory challenges presented by the healthcare market. This position will be responsible for implementing and executing regulatory and operational pathways for digital health products and services in US and global markets, ensuring their compliance against standards and Quality System regulations, performing internal and external audits of regulatory and quality systems within ADI and partners, defining and executing post-market regulatory procedures, and serving as the primary liaison to regulatory bodies. He/she will work with cross-functional teams to successfully pass regulatory submissions and audits by FDA and other regulatory bodies. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Defining and Developing a regulatory strategy for submission of our products to the FDA and other global regulatory bodies Collaborate with internal teams and organizations to execute, implement, maintain, and support regulatory and quality requirements of digital healthcare products and services. Execute post-market surveillance, device-tracking, and complaint-handling systems to adhere to regulatory standards. Support quality initiatives in close collaboration with ADI’s quality organization. Support reviews and audits of ADI’s Quality Management System (QMS) and associated product records Execute Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Work Instructions (WIs) in ADI’s QMS. Support product development teams in executing risk management, design controls, and other procedures. Support manufacturing, engineering, and clinical teams to resolve field issues and complaints and follow Corrective and Preventative Action (CAPA) procedures. Nice To Have Work experience in start-up environments. Involvement in supporting internal, supplier and partner Quality audits. Experience collaborating with globally dispersed project teams. Additional Skills, Knowledge & Abilities Understanding of cybersecurity, data privacy (HIPAA and GDPR), and other data and software standards. Exposure to clinical and quality processes in healthcare environments. Engineering skills to assist in root cause analysis and troubleshooting product non-conformance issues. Ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbal. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in an Engineering discipline. 7+ years of medical device development experience Executed pre-market and post-market regulatory activities through at least one complete product life cycle. Strong experience with medical Quality Management Systems (preferably, eQMS systems) – Master Control, Qualio, etc. Understanding of regulatory and quality standards, including 21 CFR 820, ISO-13485:2016, and international standards. Exposure to FDA guidance and IEC, ANSI, AAMI, and other standards recommended by FDA, EU commission, and other governing bodies. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Analog Devices is seeking an Mixed-Signal IC Design Engineer who will participate in analysis, research, design, simulation, characterization, and release-to-production of high-performance, high-speed integrated circuits, working as part of the world’s leading high-speed data converter team. The team has an excellent track record of producing breakthrough, innovative technologies including RF DACs and ADCs, based on a variety of architectures and in cutting-edge process technologies. Products have won industry and academic recognition at conferences such as ISSCC. As part of the team, the candidate will be mentored by leading converter experts, providing an opportunity to launch a successful career. The candidate must have demonstrated coursework and projects in state-of-the-art process technologies and should exhibit a strong, intuitive capability in solving complex challenges. The successful candidate will be self-motivated and be able to work effectively within a team. Qualifications Education and Experience Requirements: M.S. or Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering with relevant coursework and projects in analog or mixed signal CMOS design Additional Qualifications Basic understanding of circuits such as low noise amplifiers, precision voltage and current references, LDOs. The candidate will have the opportunity to gain system level design experience, learn analog BiCMOS SiGe high speed design, work with internal BiCMOS and fine line CMOS processes and collaborate closely with an experienced and motivated development team. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Have you ever wanted to get into the electronics field? Have you always been fascinated by technology? Are you an established electronics manufacturing professional? Check out the opportunities ADI has for Manufacturing Assembly Associates! We’re looking to hire and cross-train several motivated individuals looking for a long-term career in delivering innovation that keeps ADI’s customers Ahead of What’s Possible™. Position Overview Analog Devices Inc., Chelmsford Massachusetts facility is looking for Manufacturing Assembly Associates to support our continued growth in the manufacture of high-performance microwave modules and sub-systems. Customers trust Analog Devices to deliver integrated electronics and ADI is interested in energetic and organized team players that want to deliver quality products in a high-tech manufacturing environment. We Are Looking For Microwave Electronics Assemblers With 1 to 3-years working as a Micro assembly/Mechanical assembly preferred or related experience. Multiple shift Schedules: First and second shift positions available All applicants must be team players highly motivated to learn the complex assembly requirements of microwave systems. This is a hands-on position that requires a strong ability to work on delicate parts utilizing a microscope. Communication skills and a high energy and commitment to quality products are extremely important. This role includes working on continuous improvement teams along with development engineering and manufacturing. All candidates will have the opportunity to be trained in soldering to IPC-610 as well as other skills using internal resources and certified outside trainers. Requirements: The Manufacturing Assembly Associate position requires a high school diploma. A diploma from a Vocational High School or Technical Diploma is a plus. Must be a US citizen and able/willing to obtain a government security clearance. Ability to follow both verbal and written instructions and documentation. Operation of a computer Commitment to learn and develop new skills Security clearance is required (application will be done through ADI) Specific Responsibilities Ability to work 8 hours under the microscope utilizing miniaturized hand tools such as tweezers and fine screwdrivers. Assembly of microwave subassemblies using hybrid techniques. In process inspection and self-inspection. MMIC Die attach of chip components using silver epoxy. Hybrid circuit assemblies using silver epoxy and solder. Hand solder components, wires, and jumpers into the assemblies. Ensure work areas are kept neat, clean, and organized per company guideline. Assemble and/or solder electronic components to printed circuit boards. Good dexterity, eye / hand coordination. Ability to read and work from detailed process sheets, prints and drawings. Good computer skills are required to support retrieval of drawings. and work instructions as well as other job activities. Why work at ADI: At ADI we offer the best in manufacturing capability and teamwork and continuous improvement, while requiring a commitment to work ethically and with attention to quality. We place great value on individual judgment and allow our employees the freedom to explore new ideas. In addition, ADI emphasizes professional development and mentoring, offering both internal and external training opportunities and accelerated career growth opportunities for high performing individuals. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Join an industry-leading innovator in analog and power circuits and develop next-generation technology solutions for consumer, medical, industrial, and automotive applications. Apply your education and industry experience to solve problems that matter. Engage with a collaborative team of highly skilled engineers to deliver innovative products that can impact the world. This opportunity, within Maxim's Advanced Research and Development team, has a focus on developing next generation technologies and disruptive solutions in the power management space. The ideal candidate would have a wide range of design and analysis capabilities, an ability to innovate new engineering solutions, and a drive to create useful engineering solutions for saleable products. The technical focus is on power conversion, encompassing topologies and control for switching converter applications. System level design responsibilities include co-optimization of power circuits and control, invention of new converter architectures to improve energy storage device and power switch utilization, and developing tools and models to streamline the power converter design flow. Silicon level design responsibilities include innovating and realizing commercial products using Maxim's state-of-the-art sub-micron BCD power processes. Requirements MSEE degree with 4+ years experience, or PhD degree, with focus on power conversion circuits and IC design. Strong intuitive and analytical understanding of magnetic structures and field solutions Academic coursework and lab experience building switching power converters. Strong foundation in circuit design and analysis, including both analog and power circuits. Silicon-level design/simulation/verification experience Strong laboratory experimentation and troubleshooting skills. Excellent problem-solving skills (root cause analysis). An intellectually agile engineer who is always thinking of the deliverable as an entire solution rather than a portioned product. The electric vehicle and green-energy revolution is here, and we are changing the world with our industry leading battery monitoring technology. From the high-performance and thrill that EVs deliver to the carbon-footprint reduction that makes the world a greener place, we are looking for more innovators in product and test solutions that can help to make it all a reality. Whether you are a car-lover, a battery-geek, or a technologist with a passion for a cleaner and more sustainable future, ADI BMS is a premier career destination with a bright future. This is an excellent opportunity to join a high performing team, working on Product and Test Development of the next generation of BMS chips. The designs include industry-leading low power radio transceivers, battery monitoring technology, embedded micro-controllers, and other differentiated analog and digital components, developed in advanced technology nodes. The Product and Test team will be responsible for driving the health and quality of Analog/Mixed Signal BMS products from initial development through high-volume manufacturing. Locations: Chandler (AZ), San Jose (CA), Dallas (TX) Job Levels available: Product Engineer, Senior Product Engineer, Staff Product Engineer, Principal Product Engineer, Test Engineer, Senior Test Engineer, Staff Test Engineer, Principal Test Engineer Minimum Qualification: BSEE/MSEE degree and experience in Product and Test Development - Senior level requires a minimum of 3 years relevant experience, Staff level requires a minimum of 5 years relevant experience, and Principal level requires a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience. Both to support Analog/Mixed-Signal IC development and production for Automotive battery management products within our Automotive business unit. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. The role of the Reliability Engineer is to plan and execute stress test plans to de-risk or validate new product designs and technology platforms. Working in a team environment, testing plans may include intrinsic reliability characterizations, new package robustness evaluations, or advanced look ahead studies to draw out new mechanisms. Qualification plans for new or re-designed products, processes and packages are also developed. The Reliability Engineer also assists in the root cause analysis of qualification failures and drives appropriate corrective and preventive actions using structured problem solving methods. Sustaining support for current products would include risk assessments of any field events. Key Duties Of The Reliability Engineer Developing qualification plans, reliability evaluations, and risk assessments in a timely manner. Application of physics of failure models with regards to intrinsic semiconductor device level reliability e.g. TDDB, EM, EM and BTI Performing reliability statistical calculations, such as MTTF, MTBF, FIT, and failure rate modeling Progressing a product/technology through the product development cycle. Assisting in or developing Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) or other assessments based upon a structured risk evaluation methodology Leading structured problem solving teams using six sigma methodologies, such as 8D Communicating and interpreting qualification requirements within a cross-functional environment. Identifying and planning for application specific mission profiles Supporting internal/external customers with general reliability related inquiries. Qualifications/Skill Set BS EE, Materials, Physics, or related field; Master's Preferred. Semiconductor industry experience in packaging, wafer fabrication, design, or device physics a plus. Proficient in technical writing, project management and independent research Continuous improvement mindset Exposure to Six Sigma Green/Black Belt methodologies For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Why Work At ADI At ADI we offer the best in Reliability operational capability, teamwork, and continuous improvement, while requiring a commitment to work ethically and with attention to quality. We place great value on individual judgment and allow our employees the freedom to explore new ideas. In addition, ADI emphasizes professional development and mentoring, offering both internal and external training opportunities and accelerated career growth opportunities for high performing individuals. Other Benefits Include Flexible Work Hours: First shift hours have early morning starts, 7am start and work 8.5 hours a day, third shift hours will begin at 11:30pm and work 8 hours a day Extensive Time-Off Program: including Vacation, Sick and Holiday time off World Class Benefits: Including Medical, Dental, Mental Health, Vision Competitive Financial Programs: best in industry 401k with company match and contribution and dynamic Company Bonus Continuous Improvement Initiatives: On the job training, Tuition Reimbursement, Various Learning and Development Courses, and more The Reliability Operator reports to the 1st shift Reliability Operations Lab Sr. Supervisor and is responsible for the prioritization of work, communication and completion of tasks as outlined in the responsibilities below. Position Overview We are looking for Reliability Operations Operator Specialists or Inspectors: Placement and compensation will be determined by current skillset and experience First, Third positions available All applicants must be team players highly motivated to learn the requirements to perform reliability operations critical for ADI product qualification, production support, and customer quality satisfaction. This is a hands-on position within an ESD safe 6S environment. Requirements The operator position requires a high school diploma. A diploma from a Vocational High School, Technical Diploma or Associates Degree is a plus. Must be a US citizen or from an unrestricted country Ability to follow both verbal and written instructions and documentation, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and maintains a positive attitude Ability to work within an ESD safe environment, adhere to all safety policies and procedures, and a high energy and commitment to quality products are extremely important. Operation of a Windows computer with an ability to use MS Office including Outlook, Word, and Excel at an introductory level Able to use good judgment and a commitment to learn and develop new skills Solve routine problems to ensure that product teams can meet performance goals: Safety, Quality, Productivity, and Delivery. Determine when to stop an activity if a risk to product quality or safety occur. Work closely on an overlapping schedule with other shifts to understand daily and weekly goals to coordinate your shift activity. Treat all employees, customers, suppliers and co-workers with dignity and respect. Embrace diversity and address unconscious bias in the workplace. Familiarity with C-SAM (Scanning Acoustic Microscopy) or medical/industrial ultrasound imaging a plus but not required Minimum of 5 years’ experience desired Specific Responsibilities Completes simple to complex routine functions independently as well as under the direction of experienced operators and engineers The associate will perform both manual and automated electronics reliability operations which may require the use of a microscope. Performs a variety of processes within Reliability, such as: board testing, baking, inspecting, device loading and unloading, biased and unbiased stress starts and stops, pre-conditioning, C-SAM, and ESD/latch-up testing Works under the close guidance of senior personnel in the functional area however directly reports to a supervisor or manager. Possesses an understanding of general aspects of the job including computer skills. Promotes and maintains a high level of safety and housekeeping within a 6S environment. Participates in continuous improvement programs along with engineering, planning, and manufacturing through teamwork and on an individual basis. jobTitle: Research Scientist or Senior Research Scientist
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. ADI's analog, mixed-signal, and digital signal processing integrated circuits play a fundamental role in converting, conditioning, and processing real-world phenomena such as light, sound, temperature, motion, and pressure into electrical signals to be used in a wide array of electronic equipment. The Analog Garage Research Lab in Boston, MA researches innovative and groundbreaking technologies for Analog Devices. The Algorithmic Systems Group within Analog Garage creates advanced algorithms in the fields of signal processing, computer vision, machine learning, artificial intelligence, communication systems, and other areas of electrical engineering and computer science, and implements those algorithms in practical and efficient hardware. We are looking for Research Scientists and Senior Research Scientists to work within the Algorithmic Systems Group. Research Scientists are expected to advance the scientific and technological state of the art. They will work in a collaborative and hands-on environment to solve challenging problems that arise from ADI’s diverse portfolio of applications. Responsibilities Include Create novel algorithms specialized for applications relevant to Analog Devices. Develop software simulations and analyze performance of algorithms. Lead or contribute to prototyping efforts. Work with other researchers and engineers, inside and outside the Algorithmic Systems Group, to connect our work with the goals of business units throughout Analog Devices. Stay abreast of state-of-the-art algorithms, and research advances beyond the state of the art in areas relevant to Analog Devices. Qualifications: Assumes PhD degree or equivalent experience. Candidates should have a strong background in at least one of the following areas: signal processing, computer vision, machine learning and AI, communication systems, algorithm development, hardware engineering, or software development. This search is open to new Ph.D.’s as well as more experienced candidates. More senior candidates should have experience in organizing and leading technical projects. For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability EEO Is The Law Education Level: Master's Degree Travel Required: No

Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Description   Analog Devices is a market leader in Telecommunications Infrastructure, where we have built the industry’s leading radio solutions to address the growing capacity demand for 5G and beyond. We are committed to provide superior technology, quality, responsiveness, delivery, and cost to our customers. The Wireless Systems Group in the Wireless Communications Business Unit is responsible for developing new technologies and applications of artificial intelligence for wireless infrastructure communications. We are looking for a self-motivated individual to overcome technology challenges and solve problems at the intersection of wireless communications and RF systems with focus on AI/ML Intelligent Edge opportunities including but not limited to RF signal chain enhancement and radio access network optimization and automation. As a member of the Wireless Systems Group (WSG), you will be at the center of the system on chip development responsible for system design for the state-of-the-art wireless and radio products. Working closely with systems architect, digital designers, and firmware engineers, you will lead and build innovative solutions to complex technical and business relevant problems from simulation to implementation to full feature realization. You will help with building link level simulations and investigating algorithms for core functionalities of the wireless communications systems. You will design and validate them to allow performance sign off and enable hardware development. You will also be part of building intellectual property and participating in industry/academic research projects as well as contributing to future standard work items. Continuous learning, mastering and creation of new technologies are important in this role. Responsibilities (some to be learned on the job)   Define technical contributions in different areas of the wireless systems, cellular protocols, and network architectures. Drive concept work, specifications, simulation, and cross-functional collaboration. Build end to end simulation of sophisticated wireless systems from a multitude of signal processing and modeling disciplines. Analyze performance metrics leading to new product requirements. Conduct radio systems research for future wireless networks to enable new businesses and offer higher end to end performance by leveraging ADI’s broad portfolio. Drive results of research projects into intellectual property and product roadmaps. Qualifications MS/PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science or similar engineering field. Experience with modeling wireless systems to comprehend dependencies between system components and protocol layers and their interactions. Experience with MATLAB and Python for algorithm development, modeling, and simulation. Familiar with at least one of the following areas. Communication theory, and information theory. Signal processing, linear algebra, and convex optimization. Machine learning and deep neural network fundamentals. Beamforming, channel modeling, and RF antennas. Knowledge of cellular radio and 3GPP standards (LTE, LTE-A, 5G NR). Familiar with system level RF component characteristics and behavior. Hands-on experience in lab testing and characterization for evaluation of silicon and RF systems (preferred). Open mindset with drive for success and a solid work ethic are valued more than any particular skill. Other Specific Responsibilities Test station setup and calibration Maintenance of test data Assembly of breadboards, test fixtures and wiring harnesses. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Job Title: RFIC Layout Engineer ADI’s Aerospace and Defense business has an open position for a RFIC Layout Engineer who will do physical layout of Radio Frequency Integrated Circuits (RFICs) on advanced CMOS process nodes. You will work in a collaborative team environment and interface with other layout engineers and RFIC designers to learn the best layout design methodologies and put those learnings into practice to layout state of the art Beamformer products for Satellite and Radar communication systems. A successful candidate will be willing to learn best RF, Analog and Mixed signal layout design practices and have some level of knowledge of Cadence IC Design software. The Candidate Will Contribute In The Following Areas Layout RF and Millimeter Wave ICs, involving active and passive on-chip components. Work with IC designers to design IC floorplans for best RF performance. Extract wiring parasitics using layout tools and pass back the results to the IC design engineer. Optimize the layout of various blocks such as amplifiers, power dividers, baluns, step attenuators, time delay units & phase shifters to minimize the layout parasitic. Perform LVS, DRC and metal fill checks on the circuits blocks and top level layout to make sure the layout passes the foundry design rules. Tapeout the final layout to the foundry and work with foundry liaisons to make sure data transfer is successful for mask masking. Basic Qualifications BSEE or Associates degree with some level of exposure modern IC design and layout process flows. Demonstrated understanding electrical circuit concepts such as current, voltage, resistance, inductance, capacitance, series & parallel circuits and simple transistor circuits. Demonstrated ability to communicate with peers, managers, and project stakeholders effectively using both verbal and written communications. jobTitle: Senior, Applications Engineer, Mixed-Signal IC Design Engineering
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. ADI's Platform IP development group within the CTO office is seeking a senior-level applications/characterization engineer and lab manager to join our team. As part of this role, you will validate and characterize key strategic IPs that will be leveraged across multiple businesses/product opportunities throughout the company. A key focus area for this position will be data converters (ADCs and DACs) and their associated testing circuitry, however design efforts are likely to also cover PLLs/clocking, LDOs, precision references, power converters (buck, boost, buck/boost), smaller interface IP blocks and other mixed-signal/analog circuits. You would be in charge of leading characterization efforts for newly designed IPs and define IP validation and characterization methodologies with requirements guidance and support from the design team. You would manage 1-2 lab engineers who would help you parallelize efforts and support parallel projects in the lab. You would also serve as the lab manager, coordinate the engineering lab facility, equipment calibration and maintenance. Responsibilities Include Design automated evaluation systems for characterization of Mixed Signal ICs. This includes developing methodology, test harnesses, PCBs, planning software to automate lab measurements and analysis/evaluation code. Work with IC design engineers to create test plans, debug IC products, and generate reports. Manage and work with 1-2 lab engineers who will work alongside with you to help parallelize efforts on multiple projects. Conduct precision bench measurements to correlate with production test, gather statistical data to support design yield boundaries and debug products in development. Write and update software for instrumentation control using C# and Python. Use wide variety of instrumentation, such as spectrum analyzers, signal generators, pattern generators, high speed oscilloscopes and logic analyzers. Develop FPGA software for high-depth digital capture. Analyze performance metrics and diagnose bugs using C#, Matlab, Excel, and utility scripts. Document new IP product performance and create performance plots for data sheets. Work with business-unit test and apps engineers to provide product correlation. Serve as an Applications Engineer for critical customer issue resolution. The successful candidate will be a characterization engineer with a good working knowledge of Analog & Digital PCB design, ADC and DAC testing methods, digital data capture and pattern generation experience, and analog measurement techniques and instrumentation. He/she understands the use of analog & mixed signal devices and is capable of writing software to automate bench measurement setups using GPIB and USB controlled instrumentation. The candidate will need to work well with other engineers in a team, have strong verbal and written communication skills, and organizational skills to manage complex multi-project schedules and team resource management. Qualifications/Requirements BSEE or MSEE, with 5+ years of analog or mixed-signal IC validation/characterization experience Solid understanding of analog electronics Basic understanding of statistics needed to validate design limits Attention to details and ability to learn, adapt, and develop new skills Ability to problem solve at the circuit/systems levels and lead characterization projects Ability to work independently as well as collaborate as part of team Experience designing schematics for PCBs in Cadence and guiding layout Experience using measurement equipment such as signal generators, spectrum analyzers, digitizing oscilloscopes, pattern generators Familiarity with GPIB commands, MATLAB Experience applying Data Analysis in context of ADCs and DACs Comfortable programming in C# and Python for lab automation code Experience with EXCEL, Word, and PowerPoint Ability to generate clear, coherent, and complete characterization reports Good written and verbal communication skills, ability to interact well with customers Desirable Experience managing and leading an analog or mixed-signal product characterization Characterization experience with ADCs, DACs and PLLs with challenging specifications Broad experience validating various analog/mixed-signal blocks Signal processing knowledge and experience with Matlab/Simulink Experience updating and developing lab automation software with revision control software Experience programming FPGAs and integrating with lab automation software For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Senior Electrical Engineer Come to join Analog Devices – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For the past 50 years, Analog Devices has been inventing innovative technologies that transform lives. Get hands-on experience working with the brightest minds to solve complex problems that matter: from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. Enjoy a culture that values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous learning throughout your career and shared rewards. At ADI, we invest in you and succeed together because we believe that happy, healthy, intellectually engaged people drive our growth and market leadership. Joining ADI’s Enhanced Imaging and Interpretation (EII) Technology Group as part of the Systems Team, the Senior Electrical Engineer will specify and develop innovative Time-of-Flight (TOF) camera solutions and contribute to the components roadmap definition to advance ADI’s depth sensing market position in consumer, automotive, and industrial markets. This role offers a unique opportunity for candidates to expand their expertise by being exposed to diverse functions inside or outside ADI. Qualifications This role requires the candidate to learn new skills quickly and become familiar with a broad set of technical domains from chip-level design to computer vision systems. The key qualifications are listed below. Strong background in the practical & theoretical operation of time-of-flight cameras or lidar is a plus. Strong EE knowledge on analog and digital integrated circuit design Design of power electronics, simple regulation architectures with understanding of trade-offs and performing simulations. Experience in high-speed, mixed-signal electronic circuit design and validation Experience in CAD tools such as Allegro, PADS. Embedded systems knowledge, especially ARM-based, and firmware development using C/C++ or Python In-depth knowledge of hardware platforms (e.g. FPGA, Application Processors) and communication protocols (e.g. SPI, I2C, MIPI, GMSL, SERDES). Experience in standard methodologies in PCB design, including stack up, impedance control and noise coupling Experience in general hardware design verification, debug, schematic and layout tools, and standard test equipment Ability to write comprehensive functional requirements. Knowledge and experience in the following areas is a plus: Development and productization of TOF cameras Amplitude modulated laser-based illumination, associated drivers and associated electrical designs Software development and programming skills in Python or C/C++ In addition, since there will be a necessity to engage with all levels of the organization (both internal and external to ADI), the ideal candidate will need to demonstrate strong communication skills, appetite for educating and mentoring, as well as have a great attention to details. Responsibilities Develop, prototype and help productize new time-of-flight camera architectures in order to meet future customers’ requirements. Provide board design guidelines, reference designs, critical components placement, perform board design reviews and suggest improvements Generate block diagrams, capture schematics and BOM and work with internal teams and external partners with multi-functional input to arrive at prototype and mass-production-ready designs. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (IC design, software, applications, etc.) to define, benchmark, and improve chip and system-level performance, and ensure seamless system integration of all components. Produce training material, application notes, and white papers to increase awareness around time-of-flight imaging and ease customer adoption. Engage with ecosystem of 3rd-party partners to help scale technology across ADI’s different markets. Education & Experience B.S. or M.Sc. degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or equivalent work experience with 8+ years of analog or digital circuit design experience. jobTitle: Senior Engineer, Test Engineering - Product Development
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. SENIOR TEST DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER Automatic Test Equipment (ATE) Group under the Instrumentation Business Unit at ADI is currently looking for an experienced Test Development Engineer located in Wilmington Massachuetts. Products in this strategy are comprised of integrated high speed and precision signal chains targeted towards Automated Test Equipment applications. The Test Engineer will be responsible for designing and developing high performance test solutions on Automated Test Equipment (ATE) for first silicon verification, characterization, qualification and manufacturing of Precision Mixed Signal products. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated individual and fast learner with strong technical, analytical and communication skills. The candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate closely with an experienced development team. Responsibilities Develop product test solutions for High Performance Analog / Mixed Signal integrated circuits. Design, develop and debug multi-site, cost effective test HW/SW solutions for characterization, qualification and production wafer probe and final test. Work with design engineers in defining/developing test methodologies, test plans, test modes, SCAN and IDDq test. Define test schematics, work with lay-out engineers in designing of Printed Circuit Boards multi-site test HW. Debugging test programs, correlating production test solutions to engineering bench measurements, and transferring production test solutions to offshore, high-volume manufacturing sites. Engage and support local and offshore manufacturing to maintain production yield, high quality and resolve product and test problems after production release. Participation in New Product Development Teams and evaluation of new test systems for future applications required. Manage and maintain projects schedules that align with product introduction and release dates. Motivated, resourceful team-player who is willing to do 'whatever it takes' to get the job done. Required Skills And Coursework Desired Bachelor’s degree (Master’s degree a plus) in Electrical Engineering or relevant technical discipline such as Electronics Engineering, with 3+ years of experience involving: analyzing and debugging analog and digital circuits. Strong knowledge of analog/digital devices and C/C++/Visual Basic programming a must, plus scan test experience. Designing multi-site hardware and software solutions for Automated Test Equipment that minimize test cost and maximize test performance. Using schematic and layout tools such as Orcad, Cadence ALLEGRO. Proficient with Microsoft Office Software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Performing statistical data analysis using Excel or other data tools. Documenting and presenting test plans and evaluation reports Familiarity with Cadence tools desired. Unix operating system knowledge and lab experience with bench top instrumentation also recommended. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Experience with various commercial ATE test platforms such as Teradyne, Advantest or Eagle Test is a plus . The emergence of Ethernet and PoE solutions in single-pair networks will revolutionize automotive and building networks and systems. jobTitle: Senior Manager, Digital and Analog Mixed-Signal IC Design - Automotive SerDes
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Our Automotive Gigabit Multimedia Serial Link (GMSL) team is seeking a self-motivating, passionate engineer Analog or Mixed-Signal IC Design Engineer focusing on the design of high-performance SerDes products in advanced CMOS technologies. Job responsibilities include IC design starting from initial specification through design and layout supervision, silicon evaluation, debugging and characterization to product introduction. What is GMSL? GMSL is widely accepted in the automotive industry as the leading technology for in-car high-speed serial links that safely and securely transport video while minimizing the cost, weight and complexity of vehicle cable harnesses. An extensive portfolio of GMSL products is in full production, and GMSL links are used every day in millions of vehicles worldwide. GMSL provides cost effective video transport and bridging for a wide range of applications – from basic information displays and rearview cameras in mass market vehicles to the full set of safety critical cameras in autonomous vehicles, and high-resolution touch screens in high-end vehicles. Responsibilities Are Lead a team of highly talented design and verification engineers. Function as the chip lead and lead analog or digital designer for key projects. Responsible for both individual design work and management responsibilities. While leading key projects you will also function as one of the designers. Work with planning team to schedule the project and maintenance of the schedule. Ensure that proper methodologies and procedures are followed to ensure design quality meets specifications. Identify areas of inefficiency and methodology improvements. Ownership for the entire product development flow working with Applications, Test, and Product definition. Drive follow-up on quality issues such as customer returns, QA failures, test coverage issues. Support marketing and product definers with feasibility, area, effort level and schedule estimates. Document and implement lessons learned. Team management responsibilities including quarterly goal setting and review, focal reviews, staffing needs, development plans, and managing personnel issues. Minimum Qualifications BSEE/MSEE or equivalent plus 10+ years relevant experience Successfully led IC design teams taking products from design concepts to full production. Experience with high volume production parts. Has clear and concise written and verbal communication skills, team working experience and a pro-active approach to problem solving. If Analog Focused: The ideal candidate should have advanced knowledge of high-speed SerDes circuits such as Rx equalizers, DFEs, CDR, Tx drivers, clock generation (VCO, PLL, dividers, etc.) and bias circuitry. Has a solid background in semiconductors, transistor level designs, understanding the basic underlying device physics. Has strong circuit analysis skills, recognizing potential problems due to model limitations, high frequency effects, and device temperature effects. Has experience with Cadence design, simulation, layout, and verification tools for analog and mixed-signal designs. Test limit setting, yield and statistical analysis. If Digital Focused: Design and verification of complex digital blocks Understanding of the complete digital design flow – from specification to silicon Verification of mixed signal systems – including UVM Experience with high-speed design and data integrity Intuitive and analytical understanding of transistor-level circuit design Has experience bringing up, characterizing and debugging mixed-signal SoCs in a lab environment. Excellent communication skills and ability to work within a cross functional team are must Preferred Qualifications Analog Focused: Expertise in video protocols (DisplayPort, CSI/DSI, HDMI) and PCI Express Experience with Matlab and design of DSP blocks (digital filters, decimators, etc.) Digital Focused: Understanding of the complete digital design flow and ability to drive sound design methodology is valued. Knowledge of high-speed video protocols such as CSI/DSI, DisplayPort, PCI Express and USB Development of digital signal processing functions For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. ( ) defines innovation and excellence in Battery Management Systems. Today’s battery market continues to be driven not by cost alone but the demand for longer range vehicles, decreased charge times, and functional safety. These exacting battery management system requirements necessitate the adherence to the highest of standards with the narrowest of tolerances. With up to 40% of the sticker price of an electric vehicle attributed to the battery, performance and battery life become major factors in an EV’s brand success. As a leader in battery management systems (BMS), Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) collaborates with customers to find the best critical processes to monitor and manage electrical vehicle batteries and ensure their safety, productivity, and longevity. This position is in the new battery testing lab for automotive business unit. You play a key role scaling up electrical testing of automotive grade lithium-ion batteries using a combination of standard test equipment and ADI electronic demo boards. The product test engineer will partner with the team, made up of electrochemists, battery modeling and algorithm engineers, systems application engineers to deliver testing programs for internal R&D teams as well as external customers. Job Description Write test/evaluation/demo control/automation software Perform Lab test and evaluation of new algorithm/silicon/system, working with multifunctional team, to identify, simulate and correct functional and parametric problems. Conduct data collection and analysis Design of evaluation/test/demo boards Assist in HW/SW integration Design and build demo setups and present them to internal/external stakeholders May participate in customer visits Minimum Qualifications BSEE or BSCS degree. Experience with C/C++, Matlab/Simulink, Labview, Python Solid background in analog, digital and mixed signal circuits 5+ years experience with medium voltage and power electronics systems 5+ years of Electrical experience reading schematics, wiring things, troubleshooting low voltage circuits) 3+ years of programming experience writing and modifying basic Python scripts. 3+ years of experience with control systems Good written and verbal communications skills Solid problem-solving and trouble-shooting skills Enjoy tinkering, taking things apart and making things work Desired Skills And Experience MSEE or MSCS degree. Quality Engineer Job Description Camas Quality organization’s goal is to achieve customer satisfaction by driving continuous improvement through systematic approach to quality management, defect reduction and prevention. This position will require engagement across departments driving /leading cross-functional problem solving and continuous improvement activities. Evaluation of Non-Conforming Material and Support Disposition of the Material. Interpretation of SEM/TEM images and EDX data to solve electrical and defect problems Training and mentoring other Quality or Process Engineers on core tools e.g., SPC Tools, FMEA, MSA. Analyze customer returns, responds with 8D reports and continuous improvement summaries. Work with counterparts in sister fabs to share results, best practices and provide comparable data Collaborate with Product, Process, Design, Failure Analysis and Reliability engineering organizations to drive quality improvements & implementation of Quality Management System (QMS). Facilitate the use of structured problem-solving tools in root cause investigation and corrective action identification. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. The Analog Garage mission is to identify and develop new technologies, capabilities, and business models critical to Analog Device’s future success. Located in Boston, the Garage is a high-energy, fast-paced innovation driver for ground-breaking ideas. The Systems Engineering Team brings to life innovation within the Analog Garage and puts it in customer hands. As a Systems Software Engineer in the Garage you will collaborate with our advanced algorithm, software and hardware teams to build state-of-the-art embedded computing systems. You will also work with our customer-facing business and application teams to understand customer requirements and select appropriate hardware and software libraries for the job. Depending on the project, we use general-purpose processors, GPUs, FPGAs, DSPs and NN accelerators as computational engines. Design embedded software for edge computing systems. You will collaborate with System Architects, Algorithm Designers, Software and Hardware Engineers to take high-level system architecture and translate into working design. You will design, test, document, and maintain embedded software, such as signal processing blocks, device drivers, APIs, state machines, communication bus controllers and hardware self-tests, for ‘bare-metal’ MCUs (ARM Cortex) and/or as software sub-blocks in embedded edge-compute systems running Linux, ROS or other operating systems. You will apply modern software-engineering best practices in all of your work. You will create documentation for fellow developers and users of the system. You will integrate hardware and software, bring-up and debug the system, take measurements and document the results to make sure the system meets requirements. And your final result will be bringing embedded edge-compute systems to life and putting them in customer hands. Build automated measurement and/or data collection systems. You will collaborate with System Architects, Algorithm Designers, Software and Hardware Engineers to build sensor-to-cloud data collection systems that will allow design, training and test of state-of-the-art deep neural networks. Typical sensors might be inertial sensors, cameras, depth sensing cameras, microphones, radars, radio transceivers or others. You will write scripts in Python, Matlab or other scripting languages to configure, control, acquire data, visualize data and store it on local storage or on the cloud. You will make sure the data format, structure and quality meets requirements of Data Scientists and/or Algorithm Designers. You will create documentation for fellow developers and users of the system. Minimum Qualifications MSEE or MSCS degree Strong C/C++ programming skills Experience using ARM development tools such as Keil, IAR, Eclipse, mBed, GCC. Experience with Linux, ROS and/or other embedded OSs Solid understanding of signal chains, sampling theorem, noise, time domain to frequency domain conversion, windowing and filtering. Solid problem-solving and trouble-shooting skills For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls.
