Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Senior System Engineer Come to join Analog Devices – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For the past 50 years, Analog Devices has been inventing innovative technologies that transform lives. Get hands-on experience working with the brightest minds to solve complex problems that matter: from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. Enjoy a culture that values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous learning throughout your career and shared rewards. At ADI, we invest in you and succeed together because we believe that happy, healthy, intellectually engaged people drive our growth and market leadership. Joining ADI’s Enhanced Imaging and Interpretation (EII) Technology Group as part of the Systems Team, the Senior System Engineer will specify and develop innovative Time-of-Flight (TOF) camera solutions and contribute to the components roadmap definition to advance ADI’s depth sensing market position in consumer, automotive, and industrial markets. This role offers a unique opportunity for candidates to expand their expertise by being exposed to diverse functions inside or outside ADI. Qualifications This role requires the candidate to learn new skills quickly and become familiar with a broad set of technical domains from chip-level design to computer vision algorithms. The key qualification are listed below. Strong background in the practical & theoretical operation of time-of-flight cameras or lidar is a plus. Development of camera calibration, characterization methodologies, and infrastructure. Manufacturing processes and testing of compact camera modules. Theory and implementation of computer vision and signal processing algorithms. Software development, automation for test tools and data collection, system performance modeling and data processing/ analysis using C/C++ and Python. Ability to write comprehensive functional requirements and test plans. Knowledge and experience in the following areas is a plus: CMOS image sensor calibration Depth sensing / TOF camera calibration and characterization Depth image quality evaluation Analog and digital integrated circuits Amplitude modulated laser-based illumination, associated drivers and optics Development and productization of TOF cameras Mechanical design, tolerance analysis, 3D CAD software such as SolidWorks Thermal simulation on the camera module In addition, since there will be a necessity to engage with all levels of the organization (both internal and external to ADI), the ideal candidate will need to demonstrate strong communication skills, an appetite for educating and mentoring, as well as exhibit great attention to details. Responsibilities Develop, prototype and help productize new time-of-flight camera architectures in order to meet future customers’ requirements. Develop and deploy software and test stations for TOF image sensor camera characterization and calibration. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (IC design, software, applications, etc.) to ensure seamless system integration of all components. Work with manufacturing partners and customers to bring up calibration pipeline, characterization tools and system integration of ToF cameras. Analyze prototype/ production data to provide mentorship on engineering decisions Provide written documentation of procedures, setups, and experimental results, with strong attention to detail. Produce training material, application notes, and white papers to increase awareness about time-of-flight imaging and ease customer adoption. Engage with ecosystem of 3rd-party partners to help scale technology across ADI’s different markets. Education & Experience M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Optics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent work experience plus 5+ years of systems engineering experience. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. About Our Team Today’s cars are packed with networked software systems, pushing their processors to the limit; tomorrow’s cars go beyond it. With immersive audio platforms, precision electrification systems, and advanced warning systems, our customers are building the future on Analog Devices processors. ADI’s best-in-class CrossCore Embedded Studio development tools, the Development Tools Engineering (DTE) team strives to give our customers a development experience that allows them not only to create incredible products, but to produce them faster than ever before. Who We Are Looking For Analog Devices, Inc. is seeking software developers who like getting really low level – we're talking firmware, assembly code, and digging into schematics while enjoying a cup of coffee. You know, the deep, nasty, fun stuff. If you've written your own bootloader, designed your own board or know what a JTAG scan chain is, come roll up your sleeves with us. In the ADI Development Tools group, we can work on projects that use Java and React right down to developing our own in-circuit emulators for our processors. So come join us and expand your skillset. Most importantly, we are looking for someone who has a passion for digging in and learning new things. Who You Are You are more than just the assigned project. You’re driven by your curiosity to understand how things work – and to fix them when they don’t. You’ve got a stack of side-projects under your belt, and you’re ready to work with a team to create something larger. You enjoy your work, yet you also enjoy a work/life balance that allows you time to unwind and spend time with family and friends outside of work. You enjoy a hybrid work schedule that allows you a couple days of work from home each week. You’re ready to learn, and you’re ready to guide – whether it’s the next generation of engineers coming up behind you, or customers with a looming deadline. A Day in the Life In this role, most days will be different from the previous. Our team mainly works below the GUI layer straight down to the target processor. We develop debuggers for ADI processors that include SHARC and ARM cores. This means you will be writing the code to read/write registers, step/run/halt, set breakpoints, and read/write memory on the target processor. Within DTE we develop our own emulators, and our team writes the firmware that not only communicates through JTAG with the target processor, but also communicates with the host machine through USB. You will be encouraged to find different projects of interest within DTE and use that opportunity to expand your skillset. You may also find yourself helping a customer, whose product you own, to solve a tough issue. Minimum Qualifications BS or MS in CompE, CS, or EE with 5+ years of SW development experience Demonstrated ability to characterize, debug and troubleshoot issues in software applications A strong interest in software development for embedded devices Strong C/C++ skills Strong analytical skills and extremely detail oriented Strong interest in continually learning new skills and technologies A team player with strong communication skills as well as the ability to work autonomously in our supportive environment if required Differentiating Qualifications Familiar with Coresight DAP and JTAG debug technologies Experience using in-circuit debuggers and programmers Interest in contributing to the GDB and OpenOCD open-source projects Experience developing with an Eclipse IDE (exposure to Eclipse plug-ins is a plus), Microsoft Visual Studio and command line tools Experience with both Linux and Windows operating systems Basic proficiency in Java As part of our ongoing commitment to safeguard the health of our employees, families, our customers and the community at large from COVID-19 and its variants, ADI has adopted a policy requiring full COVID-19 vaccination by December 1, 2021. All newly hired U.S. employees will be required to show proof of vaccination or obtain an approved accommodation prior to your official start date. For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability EEO Is The Law Education Level: Bachelor's Degree Travel Required: No

jobTitle: Software Development Engineer- San Diego Location
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Software Engineer The demand for remote health monitoring and chronic disease management will continue to grow exponentially as the continuum of care extends to remote settings. Analog Devices (ADI) is well positioned to leverage its core sensor and signal processing technologies to improve the quality and availability of patient care. The Digital Business Unit is looking for an experienced Software Engineer who can play a critical role in the development of health monitoring products utilizing highly optimized Analog Front Ends (AFE), Neural Net Processors (NPU), and energy management techniques to achieve class leading performance in ultra-low power, wearable applications. Candidate may contribute in the SoC development, or software and application development for health monitoring products. The candidate Must have experience developing health monitoring ICs, products, or applications. Experience developing optimized Analog Front Ends (AFE) for specific biometric sensors to achieve optimal balance of performance and power. Familiarity with PPG, ECG, GSR and CGM desirable. Experience developing highly optimized power delivery solutions for ultra-low power products. Background in the design and implementation of SoCs for ultra-low power operation. Experience with sub-threshold design techniques desirable. Previously defined, designed, implemented novel Neural Net Processors desirable. Experience defining NPU instruction set and developing compilers for novel Neural Net Processors desirable. Experience developing software development kits (SDKs) for health monitoring products. Experience developing and implementing sophisticated power management to extend battery life for embedded products. Develop algorithms to check quality of, or process various sensor signals Be part of a multi-disciplinary team of software/hardware systems/firmware and business/marketing engineers to develop innovative health monitoring products. Minimum Qualifications BS/MS Computer Engineering or BS/MS Electrical Engineering 5 to 10 years experience working with digital systems and hardware for healthcare products, including: Digital signal processing and system prototyping (i.e. in Matlab), and/or RTL design of datapaths and computation structures Strong communication skills are required. Intelligence, enthusiasm, and a solid work ethic are valued more than any particular skill. Analog Devices (ADI) has just over $9 billion in revenue with offices around the world. As a global leader in the design and manufacturing of analog, mixed signal, power management and DSP integrated circuits, ADI is known for helping to solve its customers’ toughest engineering challenges. Collocation with ADI’s team of high reliability product development experts will benefit this role. The candidate should be comfortable with working with diverse technical teams. Required Enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program for Marketing or Electrical Engineering, in at least a third-year equivalent course level. jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. STAFF TEST DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER Automatic Test Equipment (ATE) Group under the Instrumentation Business Unit at ADI is currently looking for an experienced Test Development Engineer located in Grass Valley California. Products in this strategy are comprised of integrated high speed and precision signal chains targeted towards Automated Test Equipment applications. The Test Engineer will be responsible for designing and developing high performance test solutions on Automated Test Equipment (ATE) for first silicon verification, characterization, qualification and manufacturing of Precision Mixed Signal products. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated individual and fast learner with strong technical, analytical and communication skills. The candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate closely with an experienced development team. Responsibilities Develop product test solutions for High Performance Analog / Mixed Signal integrated circuits. Design, develop and debug multi-site, cost effective test HW/SW solutions for characterization, qualification and production wafer probe and final test. Work with design engineers in defining/developing test methodologies, test plans, test modes, SCAN and IDDq test. Define test schematics, work with lay-out engineers in designing of Printed Circuit Boards multi-site test HW. Debugging test programs, correlating production test solutions to engineering bench measurements, and transferring production test solutions to offshore, high-volume manufacturing sites. Engage and support local and offshore manufacturing to maintain production yield, high quality and resolve product and test problems after production release. Participation in New Product Development Teams and evaluation of new test systems for future applications required. Manage and maintain projects schedules that align with product introduction and release dates. Motivated, resourceful team-player who is willing to do 'whatever it takes' to get the job done. Required Skills And Coursework Desired Bachelor’s degree (Master’s degree a plus) in Electrical Engineering or relevant technical discipline such as Electronics Engineering, with 5+ years of direct experience developing ATE test solutions for complex mixed signal devices. Strong knowledge of analog/digital devices and C/C++/Visual Basic programming a must, plus scan test experience. Designing multi-site hardware and software solutions for Automated Test Equipment that minimize test cost and maximize test performance. Using schematic and layout tools such as Orcad, Cadence ALLEGRO. Proficient with Microsoft Office Software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Performing statistical data analysis using Excel or other data tools. Documenting and presenting test plans and evaluation reports Familiarity with Cadence tools desired. Unix operating system knowledge and lab experience with bench top instrumentation also recommended. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Experience with various commercial ATE test platforms such as Teradyne, Advantest or Eagle Test is preferred. Analog Devices, Inc. is looking for a Sr. Manager, Security Platforms to join our Security & Advanced Processing Platforms team in Tampa, FL, Wilmington, MA, Raleigh, NC or other ADI Site locations. Analog Devices, Inc. is a leading global high-performance analog technology company dedicated to solving our customers' most complex engineering challenges. We play a critical role at the intersection of the physical and digital world by providing the building blocks to sense, measure, interpret, connect, and power devices and systems. We design, manufacture, test, and market a broad portfolio of solutions, including integrated circuits (ICs), software and subsystems that leverage high-performance analog, mixed-signal and digital signal processing technologies. We embrace a culture of innovation and collaboration to push the state of the art. Product Security At ADI ADI has long been considered the industry leader in high performance analog/mixed signal semiconductors, and we specialize in bridging the real word to the digital world: what is increasingly referred to by the technical community as “the edge”. Over the last 5 years, our product security innovations have moved from a bolt on afterthought to center stage of all our new designs. As more and more software is embedded into silicon devices, the need for security continues to move to the forefront. Our deeply embedded security helps ensure that our edge devices are protected against any attack, and system integrity is never in question. To help achieve our goals, we use agile development techniques, coupled with Continuous Integration (CI) processes and secure design and programming practices. We leverage the most current cryptographic algorithms in our work, along with keeping an eye on the next generation of Quantum resistant algorithms that will need to be implemented in future products. Position Overview As ADI continues to grow its Security Platforms team, we have the need for a Sr. Manager, Security Platforms, that will be responsible for developing complete solutions for our next generations of embedded software security enclaves and platforms. You will have hands on all facets of designing the embedded security that keeps all of ours and our customers products secure. Y ou will lead a multi-functional, geographically disbursed engineering team to define, design, execute and deploy security solutions for ADI products. You will be intimately involved in pushing the envelope of our security technology and capability as we embrace agile hardware and software development techniques. Job Duties Lead security subsystem architecture and/or digital design Lead development of product security roadmap Promote the integration of security technology into new product designs to business unit technical leaders Execute personnel management responsibilities such a 3x3’s, career counseling and staff planning Continue to build (including recruiting and interviewing) the development team Execute IP tradeoff analysis for make vs. buy decisions Lead geographically disbursed design teams Requirements Strong engineering background in embedded system design including ASIC microarchitecture, computer architecture, SoC architecture, and custom or standard DSP or hardware accelerator microarchitecture. Experience in FPGA emulation system design preferred, including leading pre-silicon system validation, prototype bring-up, debug, validation, characterization, and module integration support Must have experience leading geographically disbursed design teams Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering, typically with 12+ years of professional experience and 4+ years management experience. Experience with silicon and software product development and understanding the product development lifecycle Experience incorporating hardware-based security techniques (Hardware Security Modules, ARM TrustZone, Secure Boot, Software Update, etc…) into a robust hardware/software system design. Experience with implementing and troubleshooting development of cryptographic algorithms (symmetric encryption, public key crypto, hash algorithms, etc.) Detailed knowledge of ARM and/or RISC-V processor subsystem architectures, on chip interconnects, and advanced debug and trace Must have prior history with working with business unit technical leaders in the integration of security technology. Additional Skills, Knowledge & Abilities Able to function as a member of a team and share knowledge Self-motivated and driven to continually improve Must be willing to push the state of the art in security capability intended for integration into digital IC designs Excellent written and verbal communication skills for both a technical and non-technical audience, with ability to clearly articulate the teams’ mission Must have the ability to create extensible and flexible security designs As part of our ongoing commitment to safeguard the health of our employees, families, our customers and the community at large from COVID-19 and its variants, ADI has adopted a policy requiring full COVID-19 vaccination by December 1, 2021. All newly hired U.S. employees will be required to show proof of vaccination or obtain an approved accommodation prior to your official start date. Job Description Job description Analog Devices is seeking a Staff Mixed Signal IC Design Engineer to join the Consumer Audio Solutions Business Unit to participate in analysis, research, design, simulation, characterization, and release-to-production of high-performance, low power, integrated circuits. As a member of the Audio design team, you will be designing the next generation of high-performance audio solutions defining the way devices are operated, the way music is enjoyed, and the way people connect to each other. The ubiquity of connected devices and voice activated devices as well as the form factor reduction in audio peripherals such as wireless earbuds, is pushing the boundaries of existing solutions, and is calling for novel approaches. The successful candidate will join a team with a track record of producing breakthrough innovative architectures for Class-D amplifiers and delta-sigma DAC’s and ADC’s, to name a few. The successful candidate must have a strong, intuitive capability in solving complex challenges. The candidate will be self-motivated and be able to work effectively within a team. jobTitle: Staff Engineer, Analog Mixed-Signal IC Design - Automotive SerDes
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Our Automotive Gigabit Multimedia Serial Link (GMSL) team is seeking a self-motivating, passionate engineer Analog or Mixed-Signal IC Design Engineer focusing on the design of high-performance SerDes products in advanced CMOS technologies. Job responsibilities include IC design starting from initial specification through design and layout supervision, silicon evaluation, debugging and characterization to product introduction. What is GMSL? GMSL is widely accepted in the automotive industry as the leading technology for in-car high-speed serial links that safely and securely transport video while minimizing the cost, weight and complexity of vehicle cable harnesses. An extensive portfolio of GMSL products is in full production, and GMSL links are used every day in millions of vehicles worldwide. GMSL provides cost effective video transport and bridging for a wide range of applications – from basic information displays and rearview cameras in mass market vehicles to the full set of safety critical cameras in autonomous vehicles, and high-resolution touch screens in high-end vehicles. Responsibilities Are Ownership of analog and mixed-signal circuits used in automotive SerDes products through all steps of product development cycle Detailed circuit design, simulations, and verification of high performance SerDes and auxiliary circuits. This includes Rx equalizers, DFEs, CDR, Tx drivers, clock generation (VCO, PLL, dividers, etc.), L/C tank oscillators, charge pumps, CMU design, and bias circuitry. Definition, evaluation, and development of architectures and specifications for individual circuit blocks Layout supervision and post-layout simulations Documentation and design reviews Lab evaluation and debug Interactions with cross-functional teams to define requirements and specifications. Assisting production test development Minimum Qualifications BSEE/MSEE or equivalent plus 5+ years relevant experience The ideal candidate should have advanced knowledge of high-speed SerDes circuits including Rx equalizers, DFEs, CDR, Tx drivers, clock generation (VCO, PLL, dividers, etc.) and bias circuitry. Has clear and concise written and verbal communication skills, team working experience and a pro-active approach to problem solving. Has experience with and advanced knowledge of Cadence design, simulation, layout, and verification tools for analog and mixed-signal designs. Has a solid background in semiconductors, understanding the basic underlying device physics of CMOS transistors, diodes, MOM capacitors, integrated inductors and implanted resistors. Has an intuitive and analytical understanding of transistor-level design and possesses good, working knowledge of small signal and large signal CMOS device models. Has strong circuit analysis skills, recognizing potential problems due to model limitations, high frequency effects, and device temperature effects. Has experience characterizing and debugging mixed-signal SoCs in a lab environment. Has experience using signal generators, oscilloscopes, BERTs, logic analyzers and data acquisition systems. Python experience for automated test setups is also a plus. Has good intuition of package and layout parasitics and experience with extracted simulations. Preferred Qualifications Expertise in video protocols (DisplayPort, CSI/DSI, HDMI) and PCI Express Experience with analog and digital behavioral modeling, design & synthesis of digital control blocks and state machines. Experience with Matlab and design of DSP blocks (digital filters, decimators, etc.) Familiarity with automated digital design (Verilog, synthesis, place & route, DFT, STA) Experience leading teams and/or projects For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Analog Devices, Inc. is looking for a Staff Digital Design Engineer to join our Digital Platforms Platform Teamin Tampa, FL, Wilmington, MA, Raleigh, NC, Bengaluru, India or at other ADI Site locations. Analog Devices, Inc. is a leading global high-performance analog technology company dedicated to solving our customers' most complex engineering challenges. We play a critical role at the intersection of the physical and digital world by providing the building blocks to sense, measure, interpret, connect, and power devices and systems. We design, manufacture, test, and market a broad portfolio of solutions, including integrated circuits (ICs), software and subsystems that leverage high-performance analog, mixed-signal and digital signal processing technologies. We embrace a culture of innovation and collaboration to push the state of the art. Digital IC Design At ADI ADI has long been considered the industry leader in high performance analog/mixed signal semiconductors, and we specialize in bridging the real word to the digital world: what is increasingly referred to by the technical community as “the edge”. Our Digital Design engineers are responsible for developing digital designs that will meet all specifications, work flawlessly in a product team’s system and be optimally manufacturable and testable. Position Overview As ADI continues to grow its capability in edge processing technology, we have the need for a Staff Digital Design Engineer that will work with a multi-functional engineering team to design, develop, and productize a range of block, subsystem, and system solutions for digital processing subsystems. You will be intimately involved in pushing the envelope of our edge processing capability as we embrace agile development techniques. You will help implement best SoC development practices and improve design methodology to maximize efficiency and predictability of our subsystems. Our development team is disbursed around the globe, so you will be able to work from any of our exisitng ADI locations. Responsibilities Provide technical leadership and guidance to small teams of Micro-architects/RTL developers working on an SoC Work closely with the architecture team to develop detailed development plan Participate in design specification, micro architecture and verification sign off reviews. Work closely with the verification team for complex debugs to resolve verification failures. Improve flows and methodologies to streamline IP development and integration Execute personnel management responsibilities such a quarterly review, career counseling and staff planning Build (including recruiting and interviewing) development teams Minimum Qualifications Experience leading chip architecture and/or digital design Strong engineering background in embedded system design including ASIC microarchitecture, computer architecture, SoC architecture, and custom or standard DSP or hardware accelerator microarchitecture. Experience in FPGA emulation system design preferred, including leading pre-silicon system validation, prototype bring-up, debug, validation, characterization, and module integration support Excellent written and verbal communication skills and solid teamwork and leadership skills. Deep understanding of both SoC design flow and embedded software development processes Must have experience working with geographically disbursed design teams Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering, with 10+ years of experience. Experience with silicon and software product development and understanding the product development lifecycle Detailed knowledge of ARM and/or RISC-V processor subsystem architectures, on chip interconnects, and advanced debug and trace Excellent written and verbal communication skills for both a technical and non-technical audience, with ability to clearly articulate the teams’ mission Able to function as a member of a team and share knowledge For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. jobTitle: Staff Engineer, IC Design - Digital SerDes
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Our Automotive Gigabit Multimedia Serial Link (GMSL) team is seeking a self-motivating, passionate engineer to perform design of high-performance SerDes products in advanced CMOS technologies. Job responsibilities include IC design starting from initial specification through design, synthesis, Place and Route, silicon evaluation, debugging to product introduction. What is GMSL? GMSL is widely accepted in the automotive industry as the leading technology for in-car high-speed serial links that safely and securely transport video while minimizing the cost, weight and complexity of vehicle cable harnesses. An extensive portfolio of GMSL products is in full production, and GMSL links are used every day in millions of vehicles worldwide. GMSL provides cost effective video transport and bridging for a wide range of applications – from basic information displays and rearview cameras in mass market vehicles to the full set of safety critical cameras in autonomous vehicles, and high-resolution touch screens in high-end vehicles. The position is located in Wilmington, MA. A small amount of travel is expected. The position offers opportunities for development. Responsibilities Are Architecting and specifying digital sections of complex mixed signal ICs, including high speed serial interfaces and solutions for routing and aggregation of video data RTL design Test bench development Functional verification Timing analysis Power consumption and power integrity analysis Guiding the physical design and DFT efforts for your designs Assisting production test development for your designs Ensuring that sound methodology is followed Minimum Qualifications BSEE/MSEE plus 5+ years of relevant experience in Electrical Engineering or related field Design and verification of complex digital blocks Understanding of the complete digital design flow – from specification to silicon Verification of mixed signal systems – including behavioral modeling and UVM Understanding of digital communications, high speed serial links and video transport Silicon bring-up in the lab Intuitive and analytical understanding of transistor-level circuit design Excellent communication skills and ability to work within a cross functional team are musts Preferred Qualifications Understanding of the complete digital design flow and ability to drive sound design methodology is valued. Knowledge of high-speed SerDes protocols such as CSI/DSI, DisplayPort, PCI Express and USB Development of digital signal processing functions Experience leading teams and/or projects Experience with FPGA development For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Mixed Signal Design Engineer Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure, and connect. The Scientific Instruments Team develops next generation solutions that transform molecules into insights in applications such as food safety, air and water quality, drug discovery and development as well as genetic sciences. In addition to this focused end market, our broad portfolio of analog and digital technologies solve problems in many other industries. Our team of analog and digital designers, layout engineers, and design verification engineers create highly integrated solutions that enable innovations in a wide variety of applications. In This Role, You Will Be Responsible For Transistor-level circuit design and simulation. Architect, implement and analyze trade-offs of analog and mixed signal blocks Understanding of device-level operation and physics Working together with a broad team of engineers distributed across the globe. Minimum Qualifications MS / PhD degree in EE or ECE with focus on mixed signal design or equivalent industry experience. jobTitle: Staff Engineer, Mixed Signal Design Engineering
jobDescription: Analog Devices (ADI) is a world leader in the design, manufacture, and marketing of a broad portfolio of high-performance analog, mixed-signal, and digital signal process (DSP) integrated circuits (ICs) used in all types of electronic equipment. ADI is dedicated to solving our customers toughest engineering challenges. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital with unmatched technologies that sense, measure, power, connect, and interpret At ADI, you will learn from the brightest minds who are here to help you grow and succeed. You will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards. Job Description Analog Devices is seeking a Staff Mixed Signal IC Design Engineer to join the Consumer Audio Solutions Business Unit to participate in analysis, research, design, simulation, characterization, and release-to-production of high-performance, low power, integrated circuits. As a member of the Audio design team, you will be designing the next generation of high-performance audio solutions defining the way devices are operated, the way music is enjoyed, and the way people connect to each other. The ubiquity of connected devices and voice activated devices as well as the form factor reduction in audio peripherals such as wireless earbuds, is pushing the boundaries of existing solutions, and is calling for novel approaches. The successful candidate will join a team with a track record of producing breakthrough innovative architectures for Class-D amplifiers and delta-sigma DAC’s and ADC’s, to name a few. The successful candidate must have a strong, intuitive capability in solving complex challenges. The candidate will be self-motivated and be able to work effectively within a team. Job Location : Wilmington, MA or Austin, TX Responsibilities Architecture investigation, design and verification of analog and mixed-signal blocks Collaboration with digital design and design verification teams for block and system integration and verification at chip level Interface with product definition, product, applications, and test, engineering to successfully bring new products from initial concept through production release Evaluate and troubleshoot complex integrated circuit problems in the laboratory Education And Experience Requirements M.S. or Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering with 5 years of experience in CMOS IC design Understanding of a wide range of circuits such as high-gain amplifiers, switched-capacitor circuits, comparators, integrators, precision voltage references, LDOs Good written and verbal communication skills and ability to work with cross-functional team Preferred Qualifications Experience in ADC/DAC design Experience in audio IC design with a passion for audio Experience in Cadence schematic capture and SPICE simulation tools Experience in delta-sigma modulator design Experience with MATLAB or other modeling tools, and specifically their application to delta-sigma modulator design Understanding of digital signal processing concepts For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. The Packaging Engineer role is based in San Jose, CA. As a member of the power package development group, responsible for the New Product Introduction (NPI), from design through qualification and release of the product to production and for the development of new module package technologies working closely with the product design engineers and the factories. jobTitle: Staff Engineer, Test Engineering - Product Development
jobDescription: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. STAFF TEST DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER Automatic Test Equipment (ATE) Group under the Instrumentation Business Unit at ADI is currently looking for an experienced Test Development Engineer located in Grass Valley California. Products in this strategy are comprised of integrated high speed and precision signal chains targeted towards Automated Test Equipment applications. The Test Engineer will be responsible for designing and developing high performance test solutions on Automated Test Equipment (ATE) for first silicon verification, characterization, qualification and manufacturing of Precision Mixed Signal products. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated individual and fast learner with strong technical, analytical and communication skills. The candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate closely with an experienced development team. Responsibilities Develop product test solutions for High Performance Analog / Mixed Signal integrated circuits. Design, develop and debug multi-site, cost effective test HW/SW solutions for characterization, qualification and production wafer probe and final test. Work with design engineers in defining/developing test methodologies, test plans, test modes, SCAN and IDDq test. Define test schematics, work with lay-out engineers in designing of Printed Circuit Boards multi-site test HW. Debugging test programs, correlating production test solutions to engineering bench measurements, and transferring production test solutions to offshore, high-volume manufacturing sites. Engage and support local and offshore manufacturing to maintain production yield, high quality and resolve product and test problems after production release. Participation in New Product Development Teams and evaluation of new test systems for future applications required. Manage and maintain projects schedules that align with product introduction and release dates. Motivated, resourceful team-player who is willing to do 'whatever it takes' to get the job done. Required Skills And Coursework Desired Bachelor’s degree (Master’s degree a plus) in Electrical Engineering or relevant technical discipline such as Electronics Engineering, with 5+ years of direct experience developing ATE test solutions for complex mixed signal devices. Strong knowledge of analog/digital devices and C/C++/Visual Basic programming a must, plus scan test experience. Designing multi-site hardware and software solutions for Automated Test Equipment that minimize test cost and maximize test performance. Using schematic and layout tools such as Orcad, Cadence ALLEGRO. Proficient with Microsoft Office Software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Performing statistical data analysis using Excel or other data tools. Documenting and presenting test plans and evaluation reports Familiarity with Cadence tools desired. Unix operating system knowledge and lab experience with bench top instrumentation also recommended. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Experience with various commercial ATE test platforms such as Teradyne, Advantest or Eagle Test is preferred. ADI’s Medical Products Group is looking for a Staff Systems Engineer to develop novel solutions in the Med Device space for remote patient monitoring. You will be part of an impactful team of thinkers and doers where drive + curiosity is encouraged & rewarded. You will work in an environment offering diverse technical challenges spanning bio-materials, electronics, mechanical design to firmware & signal processing. Who You Are You have an insatiable curiosity and drive to learn about new electronics, embedded concepts, and biology while applying that to solving engineering problems that directly improve people’s lives. You love to tinker, build, hack & take apart stuff – just to “see how it works”! You don’t mind ambiguity and thrive in a multifaceted team with a start-up culture. Job Description This is a highly technical role, and you will have accountability for your sections/modules of the project from start to finish while working in a startup-type environment. Work within the broader Systems Engineering team to turn product/ standards requirements into clear technical system specifications that can be tested against. You will be involved in concept/system architecture, design, integration and prototype build/debug/ testing across multiple engineering disciplines (electrical, firmware, mechanical, packaging) – with special emphasis on emulation and “how do I break this”? Drive collaborations with internal partner divisions across Europe and Asia and external vendors to support product development, design and debugging. Promote cross-discipline discussion and trade-offs at domain boundaries. Drive the decision-making process working closely with Regulatory and Program Management. Safety Analysis e.g., Failure modes and effects analysis (FMEA), Identification of technical risk areas and mitigation strategies. Design for X (DFX) where X is manufacturing, usability, test, reliability. Perform simulations, analyses, and lab evaluation of new medical products to identify, simulate, and correct functional and parametric problems. Own Verification and Validation (V&V) testing either internally or at external test labs (e.g. standards compliance, bio-compatibility, etc.) Assist in integration with ADI processes and Quality Management System (QMS). Requisite Skills & Experience 5 – 7 years of multi-discipline product development experience in complex electromechanical systems. Medical Device experience is preferred, but if you think you have relevant experience in areas like robotics, automotive, aerospace you should apply! Well versed in at least two technical disciplines (e.g., electrical, mechanical, embedded, bio-engineering) and conversant in most Strong experience with component selection and demonstrated ability to interpret component/ sub-module datasheets and match with the problem at hand. Familiarity and working knowledge of Medical Device standards: ISO 13485, 14971, IEC 60601 (nice to have: IEC 62304). Strong fundamentals in physics, Signal Integrity, and Power Integrity (SI/ PI). Demonstrated proficiency in MATLAB, Python, SysML, C/C++/C# or other modeling tools. Demonstrated integration and debug skills that show understanding of down-stream impact of system design choices/ trade-offs. Thorough and meticulous with an eye for detail and excellent documentation habits. Team player – enough said! Should be willing to learn & not be afraid of getting your hands dirty – must be comfortable getting onto the lab bench/ solder station if necessary. Minimum of a BS degree in Electrical, BioMedical or Systems Engineering. Analog Devices’ Multi Markets Power (MMP) business unit is seeking a Strategic Marketing Lead/Manager to grow the sales and promotion of our power product portfolio. Analog Devices’ MMP business unit portfolio consists of the industry’s highest performance power supply devices spanning multiple functions, architectures and all end markets. The MMP business development team drives the growth of revenue and market share for this portfolio, and seeks a technical marketing leader to drive our marketing strategy. The role of Strategic Marketing Lead/Manager requires a dynamic individual, possessing a technical knowledge of power products and applications, knowledge of and creative aptitude for content marketing, and the ability to motivate people while driving projects to completion. This results-oriented individual must be capable of productively interacting with people across the entire Analog Devices organization, including product line managers, marketing, sales and executives. In addition, a knowledge of channel distribution is optimal. A bachelor’s degree in EE, business or marketing, along with sufficient industry experience (7 years +) are required. Strategic Marketing develops marketing programs for new products, existing products and reference designs, targeting all customers. Marketing of new and existing products involves creating promotional campaigns to span an array of objectives from building thought leadership to positioning multiple products for a solution sell. Campaign development then requires creating, aggregating and updating technical content, and running subsequent promotion programs. A candidate must have a solid technical background and a proven track record of creativity. In addition, each marketing program must have consistent metrics and be measured. Knowledge of marketing analytics is required. A successful candidate must be capable of working on multiple projects and with multiple groups, including our internal business unit, related business units, our global field sales team and our franchise and e-commerce distributors. Key Responsibilities Include Developing a clear branding and marketing strategy Creation and management of a marketing calendar Autonomously manage creation of content across MMP Work with corporate marketing to generate monthly/quarterly promotion plans Partner with Channel Marketing to roll out similar and unique promotions to franchise and e-commerce distribution partners Simultaneously manage multiple marketing promotions ensuring on time delivery of content and collateral Consistently create new, unique technical content for various product lines including but not limited to: Whitepapers Webinars Videos Application notes Selector guides Understand our competitors’ market positions, technical benefits and weak points Work with other business units to create combined promotions targeting specific end markets and applications Demonstrate a thorough understanding of marketing techniques and best practices Regularly generate and execute new promotion ideas Connect with regional marketing to ensure global promotions and tradeshow presence Understand analytic feedback on past promotions and adjust current programs accordingly Contribute to growth of MMP revenue and market share Requirements The ideal candidate will have previous business management and/or technical marketing experience in analog semiconductors. Analog Devices’ success is driven by key individuals who have entrepreneurial spirits combined with the technical competence, vision, and initiative required to build new businesses. This is an individual contributor role, however highly qualified candidates will be given immediate management opportunities. The Digital Healthcare Business Unit is seeking a Systems Application Engineer at ADI’s Wilmington MA headquarters, to provide system design and development support in the application area of medical imaging, specifically Digital X-Ray, Computed Tomography, and Ultrasound. This position requires a strong candidate to advance reference designs and complete solutions, clearly demonstrating ADI’s value add, while optimizing customer design time and experience.  The candidate should enjoy and excel at solving large system level problems, and will operate as an interface between circuit designers, application engineers, firmware and software developers, and marketing. We are currently looking for a Process Technician for our Photo/Etch group supporting our Wafer Fabrication facility in Wilmington, MA. Responsibilities As a process technician, this position supports fab sustaining activities on A-SHIFT in the Photo and Etch areas of the Wilmington WAFER FAB. Candidate must be willing to learn new areas and be challenged. Candidate needs to work in a team environment with production, equipment engineering, maintenance technicians, process engineers, and fellow process technicians. Responsibilities Will Include Prioritize and disposition lots on hold and take action as appropriate to contain all affected material. Address down equipment using documented procedures (OCAPs) and personal experience, and relay information to equipment technicians, field service, and the other members of the Etch Engineering group. Create new or improve existing processes/procedures, including ECN generation for those changes. Partner with 5-day engineers to keep experiments and projects moving as time allows. Participate on and advise continuous improvement project teams on your shift. Qualifications High School diploma required. Two-year technical degree or actively pursuing preferred. 5 years experience in Wafer Fab operations with a minimum of 2 years experience in photo and/or etch fab areas. Must be able to work independently, and have strong written and verbal communication skills. The Wilmington C.O.P. Schedule is a rotating Schedule, Monday thru Thursday, 4 ten-hour days for 3 weeks. Friday thru Sunday, 3 twelve-hour days for 3 weeks. The 3 twelve - hour days are paid 40 hours. Automated Die Attach Process Technician Analog Devices Federal LLC is looking for an Assembly Process Engineering Technician to support first shift operations by maintaining processes and equipment used in the manufacture of complex microwave and millimeter wave electronics. This is a hands-on position that requires broad understanding of the equipment and processes. Manufacturing equipment support responsibilities will include set up, maintenance and troubleshooting of the automated die attach machines. Process support includes daily equipment setup, planned maintenance and unplanned equipment troubleshooting, as well as assisting production with identifying, responding to, and disposition of non-conforming material. The process technician will work with manufacturing personnel, other technicians, and process engineers to follow project plans, execute material testing and equipment maintenance, and collect of data for analysis. Collection of data, documentation of procedures, and training of operators are also important parts of this role. The ideal candidate will have a general knowledge of electronics manufacture, with a strong aptitude and interest in working with automated and manual assembly equipment as well as the communication skills required to work with engineering. Qualifications High school or equivalent, Associate’s degree preferred 3-10 years' experience in electronics manufacturing process support, specifically on Datacon automated die attach equipment. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to follow both verbal and written instructions, interpret equipment manuals and process documentation. General working knowledge of automated processing equipment. Good hand-eye coordination for work under a microscope is necessary Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel), Minitab statistical software, and AutoCAD are a plus. Required Skills Candidate must have and maintain a positive attitude in the workplace. The candidate must have extensive Maintenance knowledge in the Implant/ EPI area and/or Diffusion/Thin Films area. Specific equipment knowledge preferred for the Implant area are Varian Viision and E500 Implanters. Specific equipment knowledge preferred for the EPI area are ASM Epsilon 2000 and the AMAT 7700 Reactor. UX Designer The Role The role of the Digital Customer Experience (DCX) team is to create frictionless digital journeys on analog.com for customers to Find, Choose and Use Analog Devices products and solutions. As a UX Designer on the DCX team you will work closely with business leads, UX researchers, SEO & Content Specialists as well as Developers to create simple but effective digital experience for our customers. The ideal candidate will have a track record of working on UX for customer facing products and processes, ideally within the realm of Digital Customer Experience. As a UX Designer you will be passionate about the role of the customer in the creation and iteration of digital experiences and display a strong sense of empathy for design engineers, component buyers and other key audiences. Responsibilities Gain a deep understanding of the digital product you are assigned to, it’s purpose and how it should make life easier for our customers. Translate concepts into UX deliverables for the products you support. Work with and contribute to the ADI digital design system. Incorporate feedback from customer interactions to ensure design system and component library are evolving with our knowledge of customer behavior. Participate in design reviews and partake in healthy debate which results in the best customer experience. Be a champion of experimentation and support structured approaches to optimization of digital experiences. Actively contribute to the UX Design team culture, processes, and documentation. jobTitle: Wafer Fab Operator - Multiple shifts available!
jobDescription: Wafer Fabrication (Fab) Operator Come join the Analog Devices Manufacturing Team in Camas, WA! Analog Devices designs and manufactures semiconductor products, we are a global leader in producing high-performance microchips. Our products play a fundamental role in today’s connected world and are quite literally, everywhere. We produce the technology behind the most in-demand features across a wide range of application from communications, computing, and consumer electronics to robotics, medical imaging, and automobiles. This is an entry level position with no experience required, we invite you to become a member of our Manufacturing operation team! This position requires work in a clean room environment, a cleanroom environment is a hyper-hygienic environment. To keep the cleanroom free of dust, lint and hair, workers must wear special gowns known as bunny suits. The cleanroom prohibits the use of personal cell phones, makeup, hairspray, hair gel, perfume, and cologne. Performance Requirements Set up and operate production equipment while following production priorities Performs a variety of processes within the production flow, such as: baking, aligning, inspecting, etching, and cleaning the wafers Transport/deliver wafer lots throughout the cleanroom Perform quality control testing and data entry Follow all specified procedures: Safety, Cleanroom, Chemical & Wafer Handling Procedures. Promote and maintain a high level of safety and cleanliness. Participates in continuous improvement programs through teamwork and on an individual basis We offer a competitive array of benefits and workplace perks! Signing bonus for all new employees - $1,000 - $2,500 Excellent compensation package including bonuses and profit sharing! Competitive benefit package (Health, Dental, Vision etc.) 401(k) employer matching scheme Tuition assistance program Compressed work week – enjoy 3-4 days off every week! Unlimited potential for career growth within a global industry leader On-Site Cafeteria and Parking Fantastic Company Culture Schedule & Pay Our Fab operates 24/7, we offer a variety of shifts to choose from and follow a compressed work week schedule. Our wage range starts at $16/hr. base, plus shift differentials, overtime and bonuses! Available Shifts Day Shift (1) – 7AM-7PM - Sunday, Monday, Tuesday and every other Wednesday Day Shift (2) - 7AM-7PM - Every other Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday Night Shift (1) – 7PM-7AM - Sunday, Monday, Tuesday and every other Wednesday Night Shift (2) – 7PM-7AM - Every other Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday Minimum Qualifications Follow written procedures and verbal directions accurately Pushes and pulls carts with loads up to 25 pounds Walk/Stand frequently throughout 12-hour shift Basic computer operations knowledge required Performs all duties while wearing cleanroom garments such as full-body jumpsuit, safety glasses, nitrile gloves, face masks, hairnets, hoods and cleanroom shoes Sees colors (red, green, blue, white) and flashing alarms, if safety warnings occur High school diploma or GED equivalent Must be available to work weekends Preferred Qualifications Previous manufacturing/semiconductor experience is desirable, but not required. Previous work experience in any industry is preferred, but those without experience are still encouraged to apply. Ready to join our team? Submit your application today and our hiring team will review your application! The responsibilities and minimum qualifications outlined in this document are not exhaustive. The responsibilities and qualifications listed in this document include but are not limited to the content of this document. Are you a problem solver looking for a hands-on internship position with a market-leading company that will help develop your career and reward you intellectually and professionally? Analog Devices (ADI) has just over $9 billion in revenue with offices around the world. As a global leader in the design and manufacturing of analog, mixed signal, power management and DSP integrated circuits, ADI is known for helping to solve its customers’ toughest engineering challenges. With a commitment to engineering for good, ADI strives to create a more sustainable future, while also focusing on its employees through mentoring programs, employee networks and continuous learning opportunities. At ADI, you will learn from the brightest minds who are here to help you grow and succeed. During your internship, you will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. Collaborating with colleagues in an environment of respect and responsibility, you will create connections that will become a part of your professional network. ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards. The internship program features various lunch-and-learn topics and social events with other interns and full-time employees. At ADI, our goal is to develop our interns so they are the first to be considered for full-time roles. Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible. The Precision Signal Chain Tools group develops web applications that our customers use to design circuits using ADI products. Circuit components in our tools include sensors, op amps, instrumentation amplifiers, and ADCs. We develop simulation models using various techniques to enable quick and accurate simulation of our devices. Several of our tools can be found at Responsibilities Include Testing new code and features, and troubleshooting issues to determine cause and possible solutions Collecting and processing data to build simulation models for new parts to add to tools Comparing results from various simulation tools - web tools vs. LTspice vs. measured bench data Troubleshooting customer-reported issues, and documenting issues that need to be addressed/resolved Implementing fixes in code, as well as corresponding unit tests Editing schematic templates for dynamic schematic generation Minimum Qualifications Enrolled in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science program Ability to work independently and as a team member Strong problem-solving skills Excellent documentation, communication, and presentation skills Willingness to learn software tools and processes: Jira, Git, JavaScript For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare. ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. ADI At A Glance Analog Devices operates at the center of the modern digital economy, converting real-world phenomena into actionable insight with its comprehensive suite of analog and mixed signal, power management, radio frequency (RF), and digital and sensor technologies. ADI serves 125,000 customers worldwide with more than 75,000 products in the industrial, communications, automotive, and consumer markets. ADI is headquartered in Wilmington, MA. Visit Description   Analog Devices is a market leader in Telecommunications Infrastructure, where we have built the industry’s leading radio solutions to address the growing capacity demand for 5G and beyond. We are committed to provide superior technology, quality, responsiveness, delivery, and cost to our customers. The Wireless Systems Group in the Wireless Communications Business Unit is responsible for developing new technologies and applications of artificial intelligence for wireless infrastructure communications. We are looking for a self-motivated individual to overcome technology challenges and solve problems at the intersection of wireless communications and RF systems with focus on AI/ML Intelligent Edge opportunities including but not limited to RF signal chain enhancement and radio access network optimization and automation. As a member of the Wireless Systems Group (WSG), you will be at the center of the system on chip development responsible for system design for the state-of-the-art wireless and radio products. Working closely with systems architect, digital designers, and firmware engineers, you will lead and build innovative solutions to complex technical and business relevant problems from simulation to implementation to full feature realization. You will help with building link level simulations and investigating algorithms for core functionalities of the wireless communications systems. You will design and validate them to allow performance sign off and enable hardware development. You will also be part of building intellectual property and participating in industry/academic research projects as well as contributing to future standard work items. Continuous learning, mastering and creation of new technologies are important in this role. Responsibilities (some to be learned on the job)   Define technical contributions in different areas of the wireless systems, cellular protocols, and network architectures. Drive concept work, specifications, simulation, and cross-functional collaboration. Build end to end simulation of sophisticated wireless systems from a multitude of signal processing and modeling disciplines. Analyze performance metrics leading to new product requirements. Conduct radio systems research for future wireless networks to enable new businesses and offer higher end to end performance by leveraging ADI’s broad portfolio. Drive results of research projects into intellectual property and product roadmaps. Qualifications MS/PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science or similar engineering field. Experience with modeling wireless systems to comprehend dependencies between system components and protocol layers and their interactions. Experience with MATLAB and Python for algorithm development, modeling, and simulation. Familiar with at least one of the following areas. Communication theory, and information theory. Signal processing, linear algebra, and convex optimization. Machine learning and deep neural network fundamentals. Beamforming, channel modeling, and RF antennas. Knowledge of cellular radio and 3GPP standards (LTE, LTE-A, 5G NR). Familiar with system level RF component characteristics and behavior. Hands-on experience in lab testing and characterization for evaluation of silicon and RF systems (preferred). Open mindset with drive for success and a solid work ethic are valued more than any particular skill. For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group. EEO Is The Law Education Level: Doctorate Degree Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time
